ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil | ½ small yellow onion, finely diced | ½ red bell pepper, finely diced | 2 garlic cloves, minced | ¾ teaspoon ground cumin | ½ teaspoon smoked paprika | ¼ teaspoon dried red pepper flakes, (optional) | 1 tablespoon tomato paste | ½ (14-ounce) can diced tomato, drained slightly | ½ teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste | ¼ teaspoon black pepper, plus more to taste | 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish | 3 croissants, cut in half widthwise | 6 small eggs | crumbled feta cheese, (optional)
directions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a 6-cup jumbo muffin pan with parchment paper. Set aside. | Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium until it shimmers. Add the onion, and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 2 minutes, until softened. Add the bell pepper and garlic, and cook, stirring often, for 3 minutes. Stir in the cumin, paprika, and red pepper flakes (if using). Add the tomato paste, and cook, stirring often, for 1 minute. | Stir the drained diced tomatoes, salt, and black pepper into the vegetable mixture, and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Let the sauce simmer, uncovered, stirring as needed, until thickened and chunky, about 5 minutes. Stir in the cilantro, and remove from heat. Set aside. | Press each croissant half, cut side up, into a muffin cup, shaping it to form a base. Spoon about 2 tablespoons of the shakshuka sauce into each croissant cup. Crack 1 egg over the top of each filled cup. Season with salt and black pepper. | Bake for 14–16 minutes, until the croissants are golden and the eggs are just set. (For jammy yolks, check around the 13- or 14-minute mark.) | Remove from the oven. If desired, top with crumbled feta and more cilantro. | Enjoy! | Love this recipe? Download the Tasty app to save it and discover others like it.

ingredients: 1 cup sago | 1 lb fresh strawberries | 12 oz nata de coco (coconut jelly) | ¾ cup coconut milk | ½ cup condensed milk | 2 cups whole milk
directions: Cook the sago according to the package instructions, making sure to rinse after cooking to prevent them from sticking too much. | Stem and hull the strawberries. Cut half of the strawberries into ½-inch cubes, and leave the remaining strawberries whole. | Drain the coconut jellies in the nata de coco from the syrup, and set aside. Discard the syrup. | Place the whole strawberries, coconut milk, and condensed milk in a blender. Blend until smooth, about 2 minutes. | Stir together the cooked sago, nata de coco jellies, cubed strawberries, and blended strawberry mixture in a large bowl. Top with the whole milk. Chill in the refrigerator for 4 hours, or until ready to serve. | Ladle the sago into serving glasses. | Enjoy! | All your favorite recipes, stored in one place. Download the Tasty app and never lose a recipe again.

ingredients: ½ cup ice cubes | 10.5 oz (about 1½ cups) cold brew | ¾ cup banana milk | 3 tablespoons heavy cream | 2 teaspoons vanilla syrup | 1 teaspoon cocoa powder
directions: Pour the ice, cold brew, and banana milk into a tall glass. | Whisk together the heavy cream and vanilla syrup in a bowl until frothy and thick. | Pour the sweet cream mixture over the latte. Sprinkle with cocoa powder, and serve. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 12 oz pasta (thick udon or bucatini) | 1.5 cups grated parmesan cheese, plus more to garnish | 3 large egg yolks | 2 tablespoons gochujang | 1 teaspoon sea salt, plus more for cooking water | freshly ground black pepper, to taste | 12 oz beef bacon, chopped | 2 scallions, thinly sliced | Toasted black and white sesame seed, for serving
directions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta, and cook according to package directions for al dente. Reserve ½ cup of the pasta water, then drain the pasta. | While the pasta cooks, whisk together the Parmesan, egg yolks, gochujang, salt, and a few cracks of black pepper in a bowl until smooth and creamy. | Heat a large skillet over medium. Add the chopped beef bacon, and cook, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes, until crispy and golden. Remove some of the cooked bacon, and set aside for serving. Discard all but about 2 tablespoons of the drippings in the skillet. | Remove the skillet from heat. Add the hot, drained pasta to the bacon in the skillet. Pour the Parmesan mixture into the skillet, quickly toss to coat using tongs. Slowly pour in the reserved pasta water as needed to loosen the sauce and make it silky. | Top the pasta with extra Parmesan, scallions, sesame seeds, and the reserved crispy bacon bits. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? Use Botatouille, our AI-powered food genius in the Tasty app. Download here

ingredients: 2 large pasteurized egg yolks | 1 tablespoon sweetened condensed milk | 3 tablespoons hot water | 2 teaspoons matcha powder | ½ cup ice cubes | ½ cup milk of choice
directions: In a bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and condensed milk until creamy and frothy, about 3 minutes. Set aside. | In a small bowl, whisk together the hot water and matcha until all the large bubbles are dissolved, about 2 minutes. | Place the ice in a glass. Add your milk of choice. | Layer in the whisked matcha, followed by the creamy egg custard mixture. Serve immediately. | Enjoy! | Your favorite recipes are just a click away. Download the Tasty app to save and organize your favorites.

ingredients: cooking spray | 1 (8-count) can refrigerated cinnamon roll, (packaged glaze reserved) | 4 oz (½ block) cream cheese, softened | ¼ cup (½ stick) unsalted butter, softened | ½ teaspoon vanilla paste | ¾ cup powdered sugar | ground cinnamon, for dusting | Reserved glaze from cinnamon roll package | ⅓ cup mixed fresh berries, (such as blueberries, raspberries, or sliced strawberries) | powdered sugar, for dusting | ¼ cup cookie butter | 2 –3 cookies, crumbled
directions: Make the CinnaWaffles: Preheat a nonstick waffle maker to medium heat. Lightly coat with cooking spray. Place 1 cinnamon roll on the center of the waffle maker. Close the lid, and cook for 2–3 minutes, until the waffle is golden brown with caramelized edges. Carefully remove, and set on a wire rack or plate to cool for 2 minutes before frosting. Repeat with the remaining rolls. | While the waffles cool, make the cream cheese frosting: Beat the cream cheese and butter in a medium bowl with a hand mixer on medium speed until smooth, 1–2 minutes. Add the vanilla and powdered sugar. Beat on low speed for about 2 minutes, until fully combined. Set aside. | Make the berry glaze topping: Place the reserved cinnamon roll glaze in a small bowl, and stir until smooth. Set aside. | Make the cookie butter topping: Microwave the cookie butter in a microwavable bowl on HIGH for 15–20 seconds, until slightly melted. Stir until smooth. Set aside. | Assemble the CinnaWaffles: Top 2 CinnaWaffles with the cream cheese frosting and a light dusting of cinnamon. Top 2 CinnaWaffles with the warmed glaze, and garnish with fresh berries and a dusting of powdered sugar. Top the remaining 2 CinnaWaffles with the warmed cookie butter, and sprinkle with crumbled cookies. | Enjoy! | Love this recipe? Download the Tasty app to save it and discover others like it.

ingredients: ½ cup sugar | 2 tablespoons water | 3 large bananas | 4 ripe medium bananas | 2 large eggs | 1 cup sugar | ½ cup plain whole-milk Greek yogurt | 1 teaspoon vanilla extract | 2 cups all-purpose flour | 1 tablespoon baking powder | ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | ¾ cup unsalted butter, melted, plus more for greasing pan
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease a 9-inch round cake pan with unsalted butter, then line it with parchment paper, and grease the parchment, as well. Set aside. | Prepare the caramelized bananas: Place the sugar and water in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat, shaking the pan as needed, until an amber caramel forms, 6–8 minutes. Immediately pour the caramel into the prepared cake pan. | Slice each banana lengthwise evenly into 3 pieces. Arrange the slices, cut side down, in a spiral pattern on top of the caramel in the cake pan. Set aside. | Make the batter: Mash the ripe bananas in a large bowl using a potato masher or fork. Add the eggs, sugar, yogurt, and vanilla. Whisk until well combined. Sift in the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. Using a rubber spatula, mix together until no flour streaks remain. Stir in the melted butter until the batter is smooth. | Pour the batter evenly over the bananas in the cake pan. Transfer the pan to the preheated oven, and bake for about 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. | Let the cake cool in the pan for about 5 minutes. Carefully invert the cake onto a serving plate. Remove the parchment paper, and serve your delicious caramel banana cake. | Enjoy! | All your favorite recipes, stored in one place. Download the Tasty app and never lose a recipe again.

ingredients: 1.3 cups cottage cheese | 7 egg whites, (about 1 cup total) | ½ cup warm water | 1.5 teaspoons active dry yeast | 5 cups bread flour | 1 tablespoon kosher salt | 1 tablespoon olive oil, (optional)
directions: Process the cottage cheese and egg whites in a blender until smooth, about 30 seconds. Set aside. | Stir together the water and yeast in a large bowl. Allow the yeast to activate, about 10 minutes (you’ll know when it’s done when you see bubbles!). | Add the cottage cheese-egg mixture to the yeast mixture. Stir in the flour and salt using a whisk, transferring to a fork when the mixture is too sticky. Stir until a shaggy dough forms and you can’t mix anymore. Transfer the dough to a clean work surface. | Knead your dough until smooth, about 5 minutes. If needed, lightly rub your hands with the oil to keep the bread from sticking! | Let the dough rest, covered, in a warm spot until doubled in size, about 1 hour. Shape it into your desired shape, and let it rest for another 30 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat your oven to 415°F (around 210°C) with the rack in the lower third position. | Place your loaf in a parchment paper-lined 1-pound loaf pan. Bake in the preheated oven until the bread is golden and puffy, 45–50 minutes. | Let the bread cool slightly, about 10 minutes. Slice and serve. | Enjoy! | Don't just wing it -- plan it! Use our meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download here.

ingredients: 1 lb spicy Italian sausage links, casings removed | 3 garlic cloves, sliced | 2 cups fresh sweet corn kernels | ¼ cup heavy cream | ¼ cup shredded parmesan cheese | 3 cups cooked pasta shells | ¼ cup lemon juice, plus more for serving | ½ tablespoon red pepper flakes
directions: Add the sausage to an ungreased pan. Cook over medium heat, using a ladle to break it into small pieces, until sausage is browned all over and mostly cooked through, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic. Cook, stirring often, until the garlic is fragrant and slightly golden, about 1 minute. | Stir in the corn. Cook, stirring often, until the corn softens, about 1 minute. Stir in the cream and Parmesan. Cook, stirring often, until the cream thickens, about 30 seconds. Stir in the pasta shells and lemon juice. Toss to combine, and top with red pepper flakes and more lemon juice. | Enjoy! | Meal planning made easy with the Tasty app. Download now to see exclusive curated meal plans.

ingredients: 2 (14½-ounce) cans chicken broths | 2 cups water | 8 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided | 1.5 cups quick grits | 2 cups shredded gruyère cheese | 2 cups shredded parmesan cheese | 1 cup heavy cream | kosher salt, to taste | 3 large eggs, beaten | 2 cups panko bread crumbs | 1 cup vegetable oil | 1.5 lb large peeled, deveined shrimp | ½ tablespoon old bay seasoning | 2 teaspoons garlic powder | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper | 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided | 2 tablespoons unsalted butter | ½ cup undrained canned fire-roasted diced tomatoes | 2 bell peppers (red and yellow)s, diced | ½ white onion, diced | 3 scallions, chopped, plus more for garnish | 4 garlic cloves, minced | 2 cups heavy cream | ½ tablespoon smoked paprika | ½ tablespoon old bay seasoning | ½ tablespoon garlic powder | 1.5 cups shredded parmesan cheese
directions: Make the grits cakes: In a pot, bring the broth, water, and 4 tablespoons of the butter to a boil over high heat. Slowly whisk in the grits. Reduce the heat to low. Cook, stirring often, until soft and thickened, 3–4 minutes. Stir in the Gruyère, Parmesan, heavy cream, and remaining 4 tablespoons butter. Season with salt to taste. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet. Let cool for about 10 minutes. Transfer to the refrigerator, and chill until firm, at least 30 minutes or up to overnight. | While the grits are chilling, make the shrimp: Toss together the shrimp, Old Bay, garlic powder, salt, cayenne, and 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a bowl. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over high heat until it shimmers. Add the shrimp, and cook on both sides until just cooked, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from the skillet, and set aside. | Make the cream sauce: Add the butter to the same skillet, and melt over medium heat. Add the diced tomatoes, bell peppers, onion, scallions, and garlic. Cook, stirring often, until softened, about 1 minute. Stir in the heavy cream, paprika, Old Bay, and garlic powder. Simmer over medium heat, stirring constantly, until slightly thickened, 3–5 minutes. Stir in the Parmesan. Return the shrimp to the sauce mixture, and stir to evenly coat. | Cut the chilled grits into 12 (about 4-inch) rounds. Place the eggs in a bowl, and place the panko in another bowl.  Dip each grits round into the eggs, then coat in the panko. | Heat the vegetable oil in a heavy pan over medium heat. Working in batches, add the grits rounds, and cook until golden and crispy on both sides, 1–2 minutes per side. Set aside. | Arrange the grits cakes evenly on plates. Spoon the shrimp and sauce over the top. Garnish with more scallions. | Enjoy! | Busy? Plan your meals for the week using our exclusive meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download now and get organized.

ingredients: 2.25 cups uncooked old-fashioned rolled oats (or 2 cups store-bought oat flour) | ½ cup vanilla protein powder | 1 teaspoon superfood powder, (optional) | 1 teaspoon kosher salt or sea salt | 1 cup natural creamy peanut butter | ½ cup honey, plus more as needed | 3 tablespoons coconut oil, melted, plus more as needed | 2 teaspoons vanilla extract | 2 tablespoons miniature chocolate chips, (optional) | flaky sea salt, (optional)
directions: Line a 9-inch square baking dish with parchment paper. Set aside. | In a food processor, pulse the oats until a fine texture is reached. (You should have about 2 cups of ground oat flour. If using store-bought oat flour, simply measure 2 cups.) Pour the oat flour into a large bowl. | Stir in the protein powder, superfood powder (if using), and kosher salt until well combined. | Stir in the peanut butter, honey, coconut oil, and vanilla until well combined, using your hands to fully incorporate. The mixture should be firm but soft. If it’s dry or crumbly, add an additional 1 tablespoon honey or coconut oil. | Transfer the mixture to the parchment-lined dish. Using a spatula, spread evenly, pressing the mixture into the bottom of the dish. Refrigerate until set, about 1 hour. | If desired, top with chocolate chips and flaky salt. Remove from the dish, and place on a cutting board. Using a sharp knife, cut evenly into 12 bars. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. | Enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. Download the Tasty app and save your favorites for easy access.

ingredients: cooking spray | 3 cups cold water, divided | 3 tablespoons agar agar powder, divided | 2.5 cups granulated sugar, divided | ¼ teaspoon lychee extract, (or any flavor, optional) | food coloring | ¾ cup jelly of choice | Edible gold paint or gold leaf, optional
directions: Lightly coat silicone sheet molds (40 small molds total) with cooking spray or line with parchment. Set aside. | In a large nonstick saucepan, stir together 1½ cups of the cold water and 1½ tablespoons of the agar powder. Bring to a boil, stirring, over medium heat. Stir in 1¼ cups of the sugar. Boil, stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes, until thick and glossy. Remove from heat. Stir in the lychee extract and food coloring. | Pour the mixture into the prepared molds (each mold will be filled about halfway). Let cool for 15 minutes. Transfer to the refrigerator, and chill for about 1 hour, or until set. | Spoon about 1 teaspoon jelly into the center of each mold. Set aside at room temperature. | Repeat Step 2 with the remaining cold water, agar powder, sugar, lychee extract, and food coloring. Pour the warm mixture over the jelly in the molds to fill. Let set for 2–3 hours at room temperature, until firm. Remove the jellies from the molds, and cut into gem-like shapes. (Save the scraps for decoration!) | Place the gem pieces on a wire rack or baking sheet. Loosely cover with parchment paper, and let air-dry at room temperature for 7 days, flipping candies 1 time per day. | If desired, decorate finished candies with edible gold paint or gold leaf for extra sparkle. Store candies in an airtight container at room temperature for 2 to 3 weeks. These make stunning gifts and party treats. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 4 sticks (2 cups) unsalted butter, melted, divided | 4 cups unsalted raw pistachios, plus more for garnish | ½ cup Pistachio butter | 2 (16-ounce) boxes Signature SELECT® Phyllo Dough Pastry Sheets, thawed | ¾ cup honey | ¾ cup water | ¾ cup granulated sugar | melted milk chocolate, for garnish
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a 9½ x 13-inch baking sheet with parchment paper, and grease with some of the melted butter. | In a food processor, grind the pistachios for 3–5 minutes, until they are coarsely processed. Add the pistachio butter, and process for 2–3 minutes, until everything is incorporated and the mixture resembles wet sand. | Unroll the 2 boxes of phyllo sheets, and cut them in half. (You should have approximately 72 sheets total.) Divide the phyllo sheets into 3 even portions (24 sheets each). | Arrange 24 sheets of phyllo on the prepared baking sheet. Generously brush the top sheet with one-third of the melted butter. Spread half of the pistachio mixture evenly over the top phyllo. | Repeat with another layer of 24 phyllo sheets, generously buttering the top sheet. Spread the top evenly with the remaining pistachio mixture. | Top with the last layer of 24 phyllo sheets, buttering the top sheet. | Pour the remaining melted butter evenly over the top of the baklava. Using a sharp knife, cut parallel vertical strips into the baklava. Cut diagonally across the strip to form diamond shapes. | Bake in the preheated oven for 40–50 minutes, until golden brown, rotating the baking sheet halfway through baking. | Meanwhile, combine the honey, water, and sugar in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring, 3–5 minutes, until the sugar dissolves. Reduce the heat to medium, and simmer, undisturbed, for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, and set aside. | Remove the baked baklava from the oven, and immediately pour the honey syrup evenly over it. Let cool, uncovered, at room temperature until completely cooled, for at least 4 hours or up to overnight. | Garnish the baklava with additional chopped pistachios, and drizzle with melted milk chocolate. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? Use Botatouille, our AI-powered food genius in the Tasty app. Download here

ingredients: 2 large eggs | salt, to taste | pepper, to taste | cooking spray | 1 bread slouse, cut in half | 1 green cabbage leaf | 1 Spam slice | kewpie mayonnaise, optional | Sriracha, optional | furikake, optional
directions: In a bowl, whisk together the eggs until combined. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside. | Heat a medium pan over medium heat. Coat with cooking spray. Add the eggs, and do not stir. Immediately dip the bread halves in the eggs, then flip the bread, and dip again. Place the bread pieces on top of the eggs, being careful not to disturb the eggs. | Once the bottom of the eggs are cooked and opaque, about 2 minutes, flip the eggs over so the bread is on the bottom and the eggs are open on top. Layer on the cabbage, Spam, and optional toppings like mayo, Sriracha, and furikake. | Once the bread is toasted, about 1 minute, fold in the edges of the egg, and fold the sandwich in half so the bread is on both outer sides. Serve immediately. | Enjoy! | Your favorite recipes are just a click away. Download the Tasty app to save and organize your favorites.

ingredients: 1.5 cups cooked white rice | 2 (5.29-ounce) cans tuna | 3 scallions, sliced | 3 tablespoons seasoned seaweed snack | 3 tablespoons kewpie mayonnaise | 2 tablespoons Sriracha | 1 tablespoon soy sauce | 1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil | salt, to taste | pepper, to taste
directions: Place the cooked rice, tuna, scallions, seasoned seaweed, mayo, Sriracha, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a large bowl. Stir together using a spatula until all the components are combined. Adjust the seasoning to taste with salt and pepper. | Using your hands, mold the rice mixture into a ball, and serve with extra kewpie! | Love this recipe? Download the Tasty app to save it and discover others like it.

ingredients: ½ lb uncooked rigatoni | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 1 small shallot, minced | 3 garlic cloves, minced | ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes | 3 tablespoons tomato paste | 3 tablespoons vodka | ¾ cup heavy cream | ½ cup grated parmesan cheese, divided | 2 (2-ounce) balls burrata cheeses | fresh basil, for serving
directions: Bring a large pot of heavily salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the rigatoni, and cook according to the package directions for al dente. Reserve 1 cup of the pasta water, then drain the pasta. | While the pasta cooks, heat the oil in a large high-sided saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallot, and cook, stirring often, until soft and translucent, 3–4 minutes. Stir in the garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring often, for 1–2 minutes, until fragrant. | Add the tomato paste to the shallot mixture. Cook, stirring often, until the tomato paste turns deep red and is slightly caramelized, 2–3 minutes. | Add the vodka to the shallot mixture, scraping up any bits stuck to the pan. Cook, stirring and scraping, for about 2 minutes, until the liquid has reduced slightly and the strong alcohol smell dissipates. | Stir the heavy cream into the shallot mixture. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is bubbling and starting to thicken, 4–5 minutes. | Add the pasta to the sauce mixture, along with ½ cup of the reserved pasta water. Toss everything together, and let it cook for 2–3 minutes, stirring until the sauce thickens and clings to the pasta. If the sauce looks too thick, add a splash of the remaining reserved pasta water to loosen it up. | Remove the pasta from heat. Stir in half of the grated Parmesan cheese until melted. | Arrange the pasta on plates. Top each serving with the burrata balls, the remaining Parmesan cheese, and fresh basil. | Enjoy! | Hate losing that perfect recipe? Save and organize recipes easily on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless salmon,  cut into ¼-inch cubes | 2 tablespoons kewpie mayonnaise | Juice of 1 lime | 1 teaspoon sesame oil | ½ tablespoon soy sauce | ¼ teaspoon garlic powder | ¼ teaspoon chili powder | 6 rice paper sheets | 6 nori sheets | ¾ cup ice water | ½ cup all-purpose flour | ¼ cup cornstarch | Pinch of baking powder | neutral oil, for frying | 1.5 cups cooked and cooled sushi rice | 1 tablespoon rice vinegar | ½ tablespoon sugar | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | Spicy mayo | sliced green onion | sliced avocado | sesame seed | furikake
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). | Make the marinated salmon: In a medium bowl, stir together the salmon, mayo, lime juice, sesame oil, soy sauce, garlic powder, and chili powder. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. | Make the tostada bases: Working with 1 rice paper sheet at a time, dip 1 side of each rice paper sheet into a bowl of water to dampen. Press 1 nori sheet onto the damp side to adhere. Cut the nori around the rice paper sheet into a 5-inch round. | In a medium bowl, whisk together the ice water, flour, cornstarch, and baking powder until just combined. The batter should be slightly runny. | Pour oil to a depth of ½ inch into a deep skillet. Heat oil over medium heat to 350°F (180°C). Dip the rice paper side of the nori in the flour mixture, then fry in the hot oil for about 1 minute per side, or until crisp. Drain on paper towels. | Make the rice: In a separate bowl, stir together the sushi rice, vinegar, sugar, and salt until evenly seasoned. | Using a spatula, spread the seasoned rice evenly in an 8-inch square ceramic or glass baking dish. Top with the marinated salmon mixture. Bake in the preheated oven for about 15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked. | Scoop spoonfuls of the cooked salmon mixture onto the tostada bases. Garnish with optional toppings as desired. | Don't just wing it -- plan it! Use our meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download here.

ingredients: 1 whole rotisserie chicken, shredded | 1 cup BBQ sauce (your favorite kind) | 8 provolone cheese slices | 4 croissants, sliced in half | 4 –8 Parmesan crisps, to taste | 8 tablespoons onion jam | 8 tablespoons unsalted butter
directions: Toss together the chicken and BBQ sauce until fully coated. Set aside. | Place 1 provolone cheese slice on the bottom half of each croissant. Pile on a generous portion of the BBQ chicken, then top with another slice of provolone and 1–2 Parmesan crisps for crunch. | Spread the onion jam evenly over the top halves of the croissants. | In a pan over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons of butter. Add 1 sandwich, and press down gently. Cook until the croissant is golden and crisp, the cheese is melty, and everything is warmed through, 2–3 minutes per side. Repeat with the remaining butter and sandwiches. | Enjoy! | All your favorite recipes, stored in one place. Download the Tasty app and never lose a recipe again.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon neutral oil | 1 lb small Yukon gold potatoes, scrubbed and halved | 3 tablespoons sliced green onions, optional | 1 chili pepper, optional | 3 tablespoons water | 2.5 tablespoons soy sauce | 2 tablespoons sugar or light corn syrup | 1 teaspoon garlic powder | 1 teaspoon toasted sesame oil | 1 teaspoon fish sauce | 1 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds
directions: Heat the neutral oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Add the potatoes to the pan, cut side down. Cook, undisturbed, for about 3 minutes, or until the bottom of the potatoes are a deep golden brown. | Meanwhile, make the sauce: Stir together the water, soy sauce, sugar, garlic powder, sesame oil, fish sauce, and sesame seeds in a bowl. Set aside. | Add the sauce to the browned potatoes in the pan. Cover pan, and simmer over medium-low heat for about 5 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the potatoes are fork-tender. Garnish with scallions and chili. | Enjoy! | Meal planning made easy with the Tasty app. Download now to see exclusive curated meal plans.

ingredients: 5 lemons, washed and patted dry, divided | 2 cups heavy cream, chilled | ¼ teaspoon vanilla extract | ½ cup sugar, plus 10 tablespoons, divided
directions: Zest 1 of the lemons (you should have roughly 2 tablespoons of zest). Set aside. | Cut all the lemons in half lengthwise. Using a spoon, core out the lemon flesh, leaving the lemon skins to use as posset cups. | Juice the cored lemon flesh until you get ⅓ cup plus 2 tablespoons juice. Pour the juice through a strainer, discarding seeds. | Place the lemon zest and ½ cup of the sugar in a pot. Using your fingers, mix together to ensure the lemon and zest are combined. Add the cream. Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer over medium-low heat, stirring often to ensure the sugar dissolves and the cream doesn't burn the bottom of the pan. Once bubbles start to form, remove from heat, and stir in the lemon juice and vanilla extract. Let the mixture cool for about 30 minutes. Strain, discarding solids. | Carefully fill each lemon peel with the strained posset mixture. Chill in the refrigerator until set, at least 4 hours or up to overnight. | To serve, sprinkle the remaining 10 tablespoons of sugar evenly over the lemon posset. Brulee the tops by torching the top on medium heat for 15 seconds, or until the sugar has caramelized and hardened. Serve immediately. | Enjoy! | Busy? Plan your meals for the week using our exclusive meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download now and get organized.

ingredients: 16 oz imitation crab, finely chopped | 3 (8-ounce) blocks cream cheeses, softened | 1.5 cups shredded mozzarella cheese | 1 cup chopped scallions | 2 tablespoons worcestershire sauce | 1 tablespoon sesame oil | 1 tablespoon soy sauce | 1 tablespoon garlic powder | 6 large onions, cut into thick rings | vegetable oil, for frying | 3 cups panko bread crumbs | 1 cup all-purpose flour | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 1 cup all-purpose flour | 1 tablespoon ground ginger | 2 teaspoons kosher salt | 1 teaspoon baking powder | 3 cups buttermilk | 2 tablespoons  sriracha | sweet chili sauce, to taste | chopped scallion, to taste | sesame seed, to taste
directions: Make the crab rangoon filling: In a large bowl, stir together the crab, cream cheese, mozzarella, scallions, Worcestershire sauce, sesame oil, soy sauce, and garlic powder until well combined and smooth. | Make the onion rings: Pair a larger onion ring with a smaller ring inside, creating a space to fill. Spoon some of the crab rangoon filling into the gap between the 2 rings, pressing gently to ensure it's packed in. Repeat the process with the remaining onion rings. Place the filled onion rings on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Freeze until firm, at least 1 hour or up to overnight. | Make the batter: Whisk together the flour, ginger, salt, and baking powder in a large bowl. Add the buttermilk and Sriracha, whisking until smooth. Set aside. | Return to the onion rings: Pour vegetable oil to a depth of 3 inches in a deep fryer or large pot. Heat oil to 370°F (188°C). Set up a dredging station: 1 bowl with the panko, with the flour, and 1 with the batter. Remove the onion rings from the freezer. Coat each ring in the flour, then dip it into the batter, letting any excess drip off. Roll the coated ring in the panko, pressing gently to coat evenly. | Working in batches, carefully lower the coated onion rings into the hot oil. Fry for about 3 minutes per batch, or until golden brown and crispy. Remove from the oil, and place on a wire rack to drain excess oil. Sprinkle fried onion rings with the salt. | Drizzle onion rings with sweet chili sauce, then sprinkle with scallions and sesame seeds. Serve hot. | Enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. Download the Tasty app and save your favorites for easy access.

ingredients: 4 tablespoons room-temperature unsalted butter, divided | 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour | ½ cup dry white wine | 3 cups heavy cream | 1 teaspoon garlic powder | 1.5 cups shredded cheddar cheese, divided | 1.5 cups shredded gruyère cheese, divided | ¼ cup grated parmesan cheese, divided | 1 tablespoon fresh thyme leaves, divided | kosher salt, to taste | black pepper, to taste | 3.5 lb Idaho® russet potatoes, peeled | minced fresh chive, for garnish (optional)
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease a 2-liter oval baking dish with 1 tablespoon of the butter, and place on top of a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Set aside. | In a medium saucepan, melt the remaining 3 tablespoons butter over medium heat. Whisk in the flour, and cook, whisking, for about 1 minute, or until slightly golden. Slowly whisk in the wine, and let cook for 1–2 minutes, until the smell of alcohol dissipates. Whisk in the heavy cream, and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is thickened and can coat the back of a spoon, 2–3 minutes. | Remove from heat. ingredients: 1 small (about 6 ounces) purple sweet potato | ⅔ cup whole milk | 1 tablespoon sweetened condensed milk | ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon | ice | 1 double-shot espresso, cooled | purple sweet potato powder, for garnish | 3 tablespoons heavy cream | 1.5 tablespoons whole milk | 1 tablespoon white chocolate coffee syrup

ingredients: 1 lb peeled, deveined shrimp | 2 tablespoons harissa paste | 1 tablespoon smoked paprika | 1 teaspoon ground cumin | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 3 garlic cloves, minced | 1 tablespoon plus 4 teaspoons olive oil, divided | ½ lemon, lemon | 1 red bell pepper, diced | 1 small red onion, diced | 2 large flour tortillas | 1 cup shredded cheese (mix of cheddar and mozzarella) | ¼ cup fresh baby spinach

ingredients: 2 Signature SELECT® Boneless Skinless Chicken Breasts | 1 Signature SELECT® Lemon, juiced and zested | 1.5 teaspoons Signature SELECT® Kosher Salt | 1 teaspoon Signature SELECT® Garlic Powder | 1 teaspoon Signature SELECT® Ground Black Pepper | 1.5 tablespoons Signature SELECT® Olive Oil | 2 cups Signature SELECT® Carrots, cut on a bias into 1-inch pieces | 2 cups Signature SELECT® Broccoli Florets, cut into bite-size pieces | 2 tablespoons Signature SELECT® Olive Oil | 1 teaspoon Signature SELECT® Kosher Salt | ¼ teaspoon Signature SELECT® Ground Black Pepper | 2 Signature SELECT® Jasmine Rice Pouches | ½ jar Signature SELECT® Pesto Sauce | ½ Signature SELECT® Lemon, juiced | 1 teaspoon Signature SELECT® Kosher Salt | ½ cup Signature SELECT® Campari Tomatoes, quartered
directions: Make the lemon-garlic chicken: In a large bowl, combine the chicken, lemon juice and zest, salt, garlic powder, and pepper. Marinate for 30 minutes in the refrigerator. | Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375°F (190°). | Make the roasted veggies: Place the carrots and broccoli on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Add the oil, salt, and pepper, and toss to coat. Roast for 25–30 minutes on the bottom oven rack, until the veggies are golden brown and tender. | Meanwhile, return to the lemon-garlic chicken: Heat the oil over medium heat in a cast-iron skillet. Add the marinated chicken, thicker side down. Cook for about 4 minutes, or until the bottoms turn golden brown. Flip over, and cook for 2 minutes. Transfer the skillet to the top oven rack, and roast for about 15 minutes, or until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°F. | Remove the chicken and roasted veggies from the oven. Let cool for 10 minutes. | Meanwhile, make the pesto jasmine rice: Microwave the rice pouches according to package instructions. Toss together the cooked rice, pesto, lemon juice, and salt in a bowl. Set aside, and cover to keep warm. | Cut the chicken in half lengthwise, then cut into bite-size pieces. | Divide the rice evenly among 4 bowls. Top each bowl with 1 row of the chicken, 1 row of the roasted veggie mixture, and 1 row of the tomatoes. Serve warm. | Enjoy!

ingredients: 4 (10-inch) flour tortillas | olive oil spray | 2 cups cubed sourdough bread | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 2 garlic cloves, minced | 1 teaspoon italian seasoning | ¼ teaspoon kosher salt | 2 garlic cloves, minced and mashed with ½ teaspoon kosher salt | 1 tablespoon anchovy paste, (optional) | 1 egg yolk | 1 tablespoon dijon mustard | 1 tablespoon lemon juice | 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce | ½ cup olive oil | ⅓ cup grated parmesan cheese | black pepper, to taste | 1 large head romaine lettuce, chopped (about 6 cups) | 2 cups shredded rotisserie chicken | ⅓ cup grated parmesan cheese
directions: Make the tortilla cones: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Stack the tortillas, and cut into quartered wedges. Fold each wedge into a cone, and secure with a toothpick. Lightly coat with olive oil spray. Place seam-side down on a parchment-lined rimmed baking sheet. Bake for about 8 minutes, or until crisp. Let cool on a wire rack. | Meanwhile, make the croutons: Increase the oven temperature to 400°F (205°C). In a bowl, toss together the bread, oil, garlic, seasoning, and salt. Spread on a parchment-lined 13 x 9-inch baking sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes, or until golden, stirring halfway through. Let cool completely, about 5 minutes. | Meanwhile, make the dressing: In a medium bowl, whisk together the garlic-salt paste, anchovy paste, egg yolk, mustard, lemon juice, and Worcestershire. Slowly whisk in the oil until emulsified. Stir in the cheese, and season with black pepper. | Make the salad: In a large bowl, toss together the lettuce, chicken, cheese, croutons, and dressing. Transfer to a cutting board, and chop everything finely until well mixed. | Spoon 2–3 tablespoons of salad into each tortilla cone. Serve immediately for best texture. | Enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. Download the Tasty app and save your favorites for easy access.

ingredients: 2 hash browns | 1 avocado | 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | ½ teaspoon black pepper | ½ teaspoon garlic powder | ¼ cup microgreens or fresh herbs | 1 egg, poached or fried | 1 teaspoon chili oil, (optional)
directions: Air-fry your hash browns to package instructions until crispy and golden. | Mash the avocado in a bowl to the desired chunkiness. Stir in the red pepper flakes, salt, pepper, and garlic powder. | Spread the avocado evenly over the hash browns. Add microgreens or herbs of choice, and finish off 1 of the hash browns with a poached or fried egg. Optionally, serve with chili oil drizzle! | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. ingredients: 1 small cauliflower head or 16 ounces cauliflower floret | 1 lb uncooked pasta | 1 cup purified water | 4 garlic cloves | ¼ cup olive oil, plus more for serving | sea salt, to taste | ground black pepper, to taste | 2 tablespoons unsalted butter | fresh basil | Grated Parmesan or Pecorino cheese
directions: Remove and discard the outer leaves from the cauliflower. Slice the cauliflower evenly into 4 portions. Remove and discard the core. Break the cauliflower into small florets. Set aside. | Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add a generous amount of salt. Add the pasta. Cook until al dente according to package instructions. Reserve 1 ½ cups pasta water. Drain pasta. Set aside. | In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add 1 cup purified water. Add the cauliflower, and cover. Cook until fork-tender, about 10 minutes, checking cauliflower every few minutes to ensure the water isn’t fully evaporated and adding ¼ cup more water if needed. | While the cauliflower cooks, mince the garlic. Set aside. | Once the cauliflower is cooked, reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the minced garlic, oil, and salt and pepper to taste. Cook, stirring often, 1–2 minutes, until fragrant. Add the butter, and stir until melted. Using a potato masher or spatula, break down the cauliflower until fine. Pour in the reserved pasta water ½ cup at a time, and cook, stirring until well combined, as needed to create the sauce. | Add the pasta to the sauce, and stir until the pasta is well coated. Add salt and pepper to taste. | Thinly slice the basil. Arrange the pasta on plates or in bowls, and generously top with grated cheese and sliced basil. ingredients: 50 garlic cloves, peeled and ends trimmed | 1 cup extra-virgin olive oil, or more as needed | 4 oz Idahoan® Buttery Homestyle Mashed Potatoes, prepared according to directions | 1.25 cups potato starch | 4 oz low-moisture mozzarella cheese, cut into 1-inch cubes | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 1 sheet sushi nori, cut into 8 (1-inch) strips | ½ cup soy sauce | ½ cup mirin | 2 tablespoons sake | 1 tablespoon brown sugar

Wrap a strip of nori around each potato mochi, then serve immediately. | Enjoy! | Don't just wing it -- plan it! Use our meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download here.

ingredients: 3 medium Yukon gold potatoes | 1 cup all-purpose flour | 2 teaspoons kosher salt, plus more for cooking water | ¼ teaspoon black pepper | 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted | 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened, divided | 1 teaspoon minced fresh chives

ingredients: 1 cup avocado oil | 30 garlic cloves, minced | 4 cups cooked sushi rice, hot | nori sheet, for serving | ½ asian pear, seeded and cut in half | ¼ cup low-sodium soy sauce | 2 tablespoons brown sugar | 2 tablespoons toasted sesame oil | 1 tablespoon gochujang | 20 garlic cloves | 1 1-inch piece fresh ginger, unpeeled | 3 tablespoons canola oil, divided | 1 lb boneless ribeye steak, thinly sliced

Add the marinated bulgogi to the skillet, and cook for about 4 minutes, or until browned. Flip and cook for 1–2 minutes, until browned on the other side and fully cooked through. Transfer the bulgogi to a plate, and let cool for about 5 minutes. | Wet your palms with water. Take a handful of the garlic rice, and make an indentation in the middle. Place a little bit of beef bulgogi in the indentation. Wrap the rice around the beef, and use your hands to form the rice into a triangle shape. (If using an onigiri mold, place the rice mixture in the mold, press lightly, and release for a perfect triangle.) | Place the reserved crispy garlic on a plate. ingredients: ice | 2 tablespoons cheesecake simple syrup | ½ cup milk (whole or 2%) | 1 double-shot espresso, cooled | 3 tablespoons heavy cream | 1.5 tablespoons milk (whole or 2%) | 1 tablespoon pistachio simple syrup | 1 teaspoon honey | crushed pistachio | Drizzle of honey

ingredients: 4 cups packed whole fresh basil leaves | ¾ cup toasted pine nuts | ½ cup freshly grated parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish | ¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil | Juice of 1 whole lemon | 3 garlic cloves | 2 teaspoons sea salt | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 8 oz mafaldine pasta | 2 tablespoons unsalted butter | 2 garlic cloves, minced | 3 lobster tails, meat removed and chopped | 1 teaspoon old bay seasoning | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 3 cooked lobster claws (optional)s

Set aside. | Make the pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the pasta, and cook according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve about ⅓ cup of pasta water, then drain the pasta. Set aside. | Make the lobster: Heat a large pan over medium heat. Add the butter, and let it melt. Add the garlic, and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the chopped lobster tails and Old Bay seasoning. Remove from heat. | Add the drained pasta to the lobster mixture in the pan. Add the pesto and a splash of the reserved pasta water to loosen it up. ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts | 1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste | 1 tablespoon olive oil, plus more as needed | 3 tablespoons unsalted butter | 2 shallots, finely minced | 4 garlic cloves, minced | ¼ cup all-purpose flour | 5 cups low-sodium chicken stock | 2 teaspoons italian seasoning | ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste | ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg | 2 cups roughly chopped broccoli florets | 8 oz uncooked fettuccine noodles | 1 cup heavy cream | ½ cup finely grated parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish | fresh parsley, for garnish
directions: Season the chicken on both sides with the salt. In a large Dutch oven or pot, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken, and cook until lightly browned and cooked through, 5–8 minutes per side, until the internal temperature reaches 165°F. Add the flour, and cook, stirring constantly, for 1–2 minutes. | Add the stock, Italian seasoning, pepper, and nutmeg. Bring to a simmer over medium. Stir in the broccoli, and cook for 5–7 minutes, until soft. | Meanwhile, cook the fettuccine in a large pot of boiling water for about 7 minutes, or until al dente. Drain the pasta, and set aside. | Cut the cooked chicken into ½-inch pieces. Reduce the heat under the soup mixture to low. Stir in the cooked chicken and heavy cream. Slowly add the Parmesan, stirring continuously to ensure the cheese melts. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with parsley and more Parmesan. | Enjoy! | Your favorite recipes are just a click away. Download the Tasty app to save and organize your favorites.

ingredients: ½ cup vanilla greek yogurt | 2 bananas, peeled | 2 pitted Medjool dates | 1 tablespoon fresh mint leaves | 1 cup loosely packed baby spinach leaves | 1 cup Vita Coco® Original Coconut Water | 2 cups ice cubes | Pinch of sea salt | Mint sprig, for garnish | ½ cup coconut cream | 1 tablespoon maple syrup | Pinch of sea salt

ingredients: 1 lb Signature SELECT® Pasta Spaghetti | 8 tablespoons unsalted butter | 50 medium garlic cloves, minced or smashed using a mortar and pestle | 1.5 tablespoons oyster sauce | 1 tablespoon Maggi seasoning | 1 tablespoon fish sauce | ⅓ cup grated Signature SELECT® Grated Parmesan Cheese, plus more for garnish | 2 tablespoons thinly sliced scallions

ingredients: 5 large strawberries | 1 tablespoon unsalted butter | 1 cup shredded kataifi | ¼ cup Pistachio butter, plus more to taste | ½ tablespoon tahini, plus more to taste | 8 oz semisweet chocolate chips | 1 tablespoon crushed pistachios, optional

Pour the mixture through a sieve into a heatproof bowl. Discard the bonito flakes. | Add about ½ cup of the strained mixture to a bowl. Add the ice cubes, radish, lemon juice, wasabi, and scallions. ingredients: ½ cup olive oil | ¼ cup balsamic vinegar | 1 tablespoon dijon mustard | 1 tablespoon honey, or to taste | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | ¼ teaspoon black pepper | 2 cups halved cherry tomatoes | 2 cups diced cucumbers | 1 cup finely diced red onion | 4 cups diced grilled chicken breast | 8 turkey bacon slices, cooked and crumbled | 4 hard-boiled eggs, chopped | 1 cup crumbled blue cheese (or feta for a milder taste) | 4 cups chopped romaine lettuce
directions: Make the dressing: In a small glass or stainless steel bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, mustard, honey, salt, and pepper until well combined and emulsified. Set aside. | Make the salad: Clean and dry 4 (27-ounce) glass mason jars with lids. Divide the ingredients evenly among the jars, layering in the following order: dressing (about 3½ tablespoons per jar), tomatoes, cucumber, onion, chicken, bacon, eggs, blue cheese, and lettuce. Press the lettuce gently to fit the jars without compacting it. | Secure lids tightly on the jars, and refrigerate for up to 4 days. | When ready to eat, shake the jar well to distribute the dressing, or pour into a large bowl and toss to combine. Serve immediately. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? Use Botatouille, our AI-powered food genius in the Tasty app. Download here

recipe_name: Dr Pepper® Blackberry Pulled Pork Sandwiches
ingredients: 3 tablespoons olive oil, divided | 2 tablespoons packed light brown sugar | 2 tablespoons kosher salt | 1 tablespoon ground black pepper | 1 tablespoon smoked paprika | ½ tablespoon garlic powder | ½ tablespoon onion powder | ½ tablespoon chili powder | 1 teaspoon ground cumin | 3.5 lb boneless pork butt, fat trimmed, and meat cut into around 4-inch pieces | 1 white onion, thinly sliced | 2 tablespoons canned chopped chipotles in adobo sauce | 20 fl oz (2½ cups) Dr Pepper® Blackberry | 2 cups beef stock | 2 cups shredded green cabbage | 2 cups shredded purple cabbage | 1 cup shredded carrots | ½ cup apple cider vinegar | ⅓ cup chopped fresh cilantro | 2 tablespoons packed light brown sugar | 2 teaspoons dijon mustard | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes | ½ teaspoon ground black pepper | ½ teaspoon garlic powder | 6 to 8 burger buns, toasted | BBQ sauce | Dr Pepper® Blackberry, for serving
directions: Make the pulled pork: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium until it shimmers. | In a bowl, mix together the light brown sugar, kosher salt, ground black pepper, smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder, and ground cumin. Rub half of the spice mixture all over the pork, reserving the remaining spice mixture. Working in batches, sear the pork in the hot oil on all sides until all of the pork has been browned, about 15 minutes. Remove pork as each batch is browned. | Add the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil to the Dutch oven. Add the onion, chipotle peppers in adobo, and the remaining spice mixture. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is tender, about 5 minutes. Place the seared pork on top of the onion, and pour in the Dr Pepper® Blackberry and beef stock. Cover with the lid, and allow to simmer over medium-high heat for 30 minutes. Place in the preheated oven, and braise for 2 hours, or until the pork is pull-apart tender. | Meanwhile, make the coleslaw: In a large bowl, toss together the green cabbage, purple cabbage, carrots, vinegar, cilantro, brown sugar, mustard, salt, red pepper flakes, black pepper, and garlic powder until well combined. Allow to sit in the refrigerator for 1 hour or until ready to serve. | Remove the pork from the oven, and allow to cool for 30 minutes. Shred the cooled pork meat. | Assemble your pulled pork sandwiches: Arrange the shredded pork evenly on the bottoms of the toasted buns. Drizzle with the desired amount of barbecue sauce, and top with coleslaw. Serve with Dr Pepper® Blackberry. | Enjoy!

recipe_name: Prosciutto & Goat Cheese Pizza With Balsamic Glaze
ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for garnish | 1 lb store-bought or homemade pizza dough, at room temperature | ⅓ cup pesto | 1 (4-ounce) soft goat cheese log, crumbled | 4 oz fresh mozzarella cheese, cut or pulled into chunks | 4 oz sliced prosciutto | 1 cup arugula | balsamic glaze, for garnish | flaky sea salt, for garnish | Dr Pepper® Blackberry, for serving
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°F). Brush the olive oil over a pizza pan or a baking sheet. | Press and flatten the dough into the desired shape on the pizza pan. | Spread the pesto evenly over the dough. Sprinkle the goat cheese and mozzarella cheese on top of the dough. Layer the prosciutto slices all over the pizza. Bake in the preheated oven for 25–30 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from the oven, and allow to cool for 10 minutes. | Garnish the pizza with arugula, balsamic glaze, and flaky sea salt. | Serve with Dr Pepper® Blackberry. | Enjoy!

ingredients: ¼ cup heavy cream | 2 tablespoons pesto, divided | 3 large eggs | kosher salt, to taste | black pepper, to taste | fresh basil leaf, for garnish
directions: Heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heat. Pour in the heavy cream. Bring to a simmer, and simmer until bubbles appear around the edges, about 1 minute. | Spoon 1 tablespoon of the pesto into the cream, and gently swirl it with a spatula. | Crack the eggs directly into the skillet, spacing them out evenly. Season with salt and pepper. | Cover with a lid, and cook until the whites are set but the yolks are still slightly runny, 3–4 minutes. | Drizzle the remaining 1 tablespoon pesto over the eggs. Garnish with basil leaves. Serve immediately. | Enjoy! | Your favorite recipes are just a click away. Download the Tasty app to save and organize your favorites.

ingredients: 3 tablespoons cold water | 1 (.25-ounce) envelope unflavored gelatin | 1 cup whole milk | 2 tablespoons granulated sugar | 2 tablespoons hot water | ½ tablespoon matcha powder | Heavy cream or sweetened condensed milk, for serving
directions: Place the cold water in a small bowl. Sprinkle with the gelatin, and let sit for about 5 minutes to fully bloom and absorb the water. | In a saucepan over low heat, warm the milk and sugar, stirring until the sugar dissolves, 2–3 minutes. Do not boil. | In a separate bowl, whisk together the hot water and matcha until smooth. | Stir the bloomed gelatin into the warm milk mixture until fully dissolved, then whisk in the matcha mixture. | Pour into silicone molds, and refrigerate until set, for at least 2 hours or up to overnight. | Gently remove from molds. Serve as is or with a drizzle of heavy cream or condensed milk. | Hate losing that perfect recipe? Save and organize recipes easily on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 3 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces | 1 tablespoon onion powder | 2 teaspoons soy sauce | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1 teaspoon chicken bouillon | cooking spray | chopped scallion, for garnish | 3 tablespoons unsalted butter | 4 garlic cloves, minced | 1 tablespoon minced ginger | 1 cup hoisin sauce | ½ cup apple juice | ½ cup soy sauce | ½ cup bourbon | ¼ cup brown sugar
directions: Make the chicken skewers: In a large bowl, toss together the chicken, onion powder, soy sauce, salt, pepper, and bouillon. Let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight for a deeper flavor. | Make the bourbon sauce: In a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the minced garlic and ginger. Cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Whisk in the hoisin, apple juice, soy sauce, bourbon, and brown sugar. Bring to a simmer over low heat. Cook, stirring often, for 5–7 minutes, until slightly thickened. Remove from heat, and set aside. | Preheat the air fryer to 375°F (190°C). | Thread the marinated chicken onto 8-inch wooden skewers (about 6 pieces per skewer). | Arrange the chicken skewers in a single layer in the air fryer basket. Coat with cooking spray, and cook for 8 minutes. | Set aside some of the bourbon sauce for serving. Brush the skewers generously with the remaining bourbon sauce. Continue cooking for 6–8 minutes, until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°F. | Brush with the reserved bourbon sauce. Garnish with scallions. | Enjoy! | Meal planning made easy with the Tasty app. Download now to see exclusive curated meal plans.

ingredients: ½ cup coconut water | 4 teaspoons magnesium powder | 2 cups tart cherry juice | ½ cup grass-fed gelatin
directions: In a medium glass or ceramic bowl, combine the coconut water and magnesium powder. Stir until fully dissolved. Add the cherry juice, and mix well. | Sprinkle the gelatin evenly over the liquid. Let it bloom for 2–3 minutes, until the mixture thickens. | Transfer the mixture to a small nonstick saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, for 2–3 minutes, until the gelatin is fully dissolved. Do not boil. | Remove from heat, and let the mixture cool for 5 minutes. (The foam on top will dissipate on its own.) | Pour the liquid into a silicone mold (11.7 x 7.6 x 0.6 inches) or a small glass container. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to overnight, until firm. | Remove the gummies from the molds, or slice into bite-sized pieces if using a container. | Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. | To use: Take 1–2 gummies 30 minutes before bed for relaxation and improved sleep. | Enjoy! | Busy? ingredients: 6 cups water | 2 tablespoons kosher salt | 8 oz uncooked pasta, spaghetti | 8 oz spicy italian sausage | 1 cup heavy cream | ¼ cup pesto | ¼ cup grated parmesan cheese | 1 tablespoon sundried tomato paste | 1 teaspoon black pepper | ½ cup cherry tomatoes | 1 fresh herb sprig, such as basil or mint
directions: Bring the water to a boil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the salt, then add the pasta. Cook per package instructions. Drain the pasta, and set aside. | Heat a medium pot over medium-high heat. Add the sausage, and let 1 side sear, about 2 minutes. Using a wooden spoon, break up the sausage into smaller pieces, and cook until the sausage is cooked through, about 5 minutes. Set aside on a plate. | Reduce the heat under the pot to low. Add the heavy cream and pesto. Stir gently to emulsify the mixture. Stir in the Parmesan, sundried tomato paste, and pepper. Add the pasta and sausage. | Arrange the pasta on a plate. Serve with tomatoes and an herb sprig. | Enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. Download the Tasty app and save your favorites for easy access.

ingredients: 1.5 lb baby Yukon gold potatoes, scrubbed | 1 tablespoon kosher salt | 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, room temperature | 4 bacon strips | 2 tablespoons avocado oil | 1 small sweet onion, sliced | 1 large garlic clove, minced | 3 cups baby spinach | 6 large eggs | 1 cup heavy cream | ¼ teaspoon kosher salt | ¼ teaspoon black pepper | ⅛ teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg | 1 (6-ounce) log goat cheese, crumbled
directions: Make the crust: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). | Add the potatoes and salt to a medium pot. Add water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat, and cook the potatoes until they are fork-tender, about 25 minutes. Drain. | Brush a 9-inch round pie pan with the butter. Arrange the drained potatoes in an even layer in the pan. Using the flat bottom of a cup, press the potatoes firmly into the bottom and about 2 inches up the sides of the pan to form a crust. Let cool completely. | Meanwhile, make the filling: In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, cook the bacon, stirring occasionally, until crisp, 10–12 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the bacon to a paper towel-lined plate. Crumble into small pieces, and set aside. | Discard the drippings in the skillet. Add the avocado oil to the skillet. Add the onion, and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic, and cook, stirring constantly, until the garlic is fragrant, about 45 seconds. Add the spinach a handful at a time, stirring until completely wilted, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat, and let cool for about 10 minutes, or until it’s not too hot to touch. | In a medium bowl, lightly beat the eggs. Add the cream, salt, pepper, and nutmeg, and whisk to combine. | Sprinkle about half of the goat cheese over the bottom of the potato crust, then add the spinach mixture, spreading it evenly. Add the remaining goat cheese, then carefully pour the egg mixture over everything. Use a fork to gently settle the egg mixture evenly around the filling. | Transfer the pan to the preheated oven, and bake until the filling puffs up, browns slightly, and a knife inserted into the center of the quiche comes out clean, 25–35 minutes. Let cool on a rack for at least 10 minutes. | Cut into wedges, and serve. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 1 english cucumber, plus more for garnish | 1 large thin-skinned lime, plus 1 lime wedge, plus more for garnish | 1 jalapeño, plus more for garnish | 4 oz silver tequila | 3 oz basil simple syrup | ice | Tajín, for garnish
directions: In a blender, combine the cucumber, lime, jalapeño, tequila, and basil simple syrup. Blend on high speed until the lime is broken down and only small specks of green remain, 1–2 minutes. | Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Place the lid on the shaker, and shake for 20 seconds. | Run a lime wedge along the rim of your glass, then dip the rim into Tajín. Fill the glass with ice, and pour the blended mixture into the glass. | Garnish with additional jalapeño, lime slices, or cucumber! | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? ingredients: ¾ cup warm water | 2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for greasing bowl | 1.5 tablespoons sugar | 1 teaspoon dried oregano, optional | 1 teaspoon garlic powder, optional | ¾ teaspoon kosher salt | 1 packet instant yeast (about 2⅓ teaspoons) | 2 ⅓ cups all-purpose flour, divided | 1 cup vodka pasta sauce | 1 tablespoon pesto | 1 cup chopped cherry tomatoes | 15 slices pepperonis | 1 teaspoon dried oregano | 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese | ½ cup fresh herbs
directions: Make the dough: Place the water, oil, sugar, oregano, garlic powder, salt, yeast, and 2 cups of the flour in a large bowl. Mix with a spatula until the dough is shaggy. Knead the dough in the bowl with your hands until pliable, 5–10 minutes, adding a few tablespoons of the remaining flour as needed if the dough is too sticky. | Grease the sides of a large bowl with some oil, and add the kneaded dough. Roll it around to coat in the oil, and cover. Let rest at room temperature for about 30 minutes, or until doubled in size. | Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). Roll the dough flat on a 10 x 15-inch parchment-lined baking sheet, gently stretching to reach the pan perimeters. | Using a fork, poke about 10 holes around the center and perimeter of the dough to prevent large bubbles when baking. Top the pizza with your toppings in the order as listed. Bake for 13–15 minutes, until golden brown and crispy. | Enjoy! | All your favorite recipes, stored in one place. ingredients: 2.5 lb russet potatoes, peeled | 2 cups sour cream | 1 (10½-ounce) can cream of chicken soup | ¾ cup (1½ sticks) melted unsalted butter, divided | 1.5 cups shredded white cheddar cheese | 2 teaspoons kosher salt | 1 teaspoon onion powder | 1 teaspoon garlic powder | 2 cups cornflakes, crushed
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F, and lightly grease a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. | Shred the potatoes using the large holes on a box grater. | Transfer the shredded potatoes to a bowl of cold water. Stir to loosen the starch, then drain the starchy water. Refill the bowl with more cold water, and repeat the process of stirring and draining until the water is clear. Drain the potatoes thoroughly, using paper towels or a clean dish towel to dry them as much as possible. | In a large bowl, combine the sour cream, cream of chicken soup, and ½ cup of the melted butter. Mix well. | Add the shredded cheese, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder. Stir until fully combined. | Mix the shredded potatoes into the cheese mixture until evenly coated. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish. | In a large bowl, combine the cornflakes with the remaining ¼ cup melted butter. Mix until the cereal is evenly coated. | Sprinkle the buttered cornflakes over the potato mixture. | Bake for 40–50 minutes, until golden and bubbly. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. ingredients: 1 cup frozen pineapple | 1 cup frozen cherries | ½ cup almond milk | ½ cup tart cherry juice | ½ ripe avocado, diced | 2 tablespoons maple syrup | ½ tablespoon vanilla colostrum | 1 teaspoon magnesium powder | coconut cream, to taste | pitaya powder, to taste
directions: In a blender, combine the pineapple, cherries, almond milk, cherry juice, avocado, maple syrup, vanilla colostrum, and magnesium powder. Blend on high speed until smooth. | In your serving glass, add a spoonful of coconut cream, then lightly sift a small amount of pitaya powder on top. Use a spoon to swirl it around the inside of the glass. | Pour the smoothie into the glass. ingredients: 3 tablespoons yellow mustard | 3 lb chuck roast | 2 tablespoons spice rub (I like Kinder’s All-Purpose Rub) | 2 tablespoons barbecue sauce | 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into 1-tablespoon pats | 1 tablespoon brown sugar | 3 baguettes, split lengthwise | Sriracha aioli | 2 cucumbers, seeds removed and cucumbers cut into julienne pieces | 1 jalapeño, sliced | Fresh cilantro sprig | 2 medium carrots, cut into julienne pieces | ½ daikon radish, cut into julienne pieces | 2 teaspoons kosher salt | 2 teaspoons sugar | ½ cup rice vinegar | ½ cup water | ½ cup granulated sugar
directions: Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C). | Rub the mustard evenly all over the chuck roast. Sprinkle the spice rub all over the chuck roast, rubbing it in with your hands to fully coat all sides. | Place the seasoned roast on a roasting rack placed over a baking sheet. Bake for 3 hours. Remove the roast from the oven, and cut into 1-inch cubes. | Add the meat to a baking dish, and toss with the barbecue sauce, butter, and brown sugar. Return to the oven, and bake until the meat is sticky and charred, about 20 minutes, stirring once after 5 minutes. | Prepare the Pickled Vegetables: Toss together the carrots, radish, salt, and sugar in a bowl. Let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes to draw out moisture. Squeeze the vegetables gently to remove the excess liquid. | In a cup or bowl, whisk together the rice vinegar, water, and sugar until dissolved. Add the vegetables to the mixture. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight for best results. | Spread a generous layer of Sriracha aïoli over the bottom half of each baguette. | Layer the burnt ends on top of the aïoli, followed by the pickled vegetables, cucumber pieces, jalapeño slices, and fresh cilantro. | Place the top half of the baguette on, and press gently to secure the fillings. | Enjoy! | Hate losing that perfect recipe? ingredients: 6 kumquat halves | 1.5 tablespoons kosher salt | 1 tablespoon sugar | 1 teaspoon msg | 2 tablespoons kosher salt | 1.5 tablespoons sugar | 1 teaspoon msg | 1 teaspoon lemon zest, plus 1 lemon wedge | Zest of 1 kumquat | ½ teaspoon freshly squeezed ginger juice (finely grate ginger, then squeeze juice in hand) | ½ oz freshly squeezed lemon juice | ½ oz passion fruit puree | ice | 4 oz ginger ale | Kumquat slice, for garnish
directions: Make the salted kumquats: Toss together the kumquats, salt, sugar, and MSG in a bowl. Let marinate at room temperature for 10 minutes, lightly mashing them to release the flavor. | Make the salt rim: Stir together the salt, sugar, MSG, lemon zest, and kumquat zest in a shallow bowl. Rub a lemon wedge around the rim of a chilled glass. Dip the rim into the salt rim mixture to coat. | Make the mocktail: In a shaker tin, combine the salted kumquats, ginger juice, lemon juice, passion fruit puree, and a scoop of ice. Shake for 10 seconds. | Strain the mixture into the prepared glass. | Pour the ginger ale over the top, gently stir, and serve immediately. Garnish with a slice of kumquat. | Don't just wing it -- plan it! Use our meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download here.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons soy sauce | 1 tablespoon oyster sauce | 1 tablespoon honey | 1 teaspoon rice vinegar | 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce | 1 teaspoon sesame oil | 1 teaspoon grated garlic | 1 teaspoon grated ginger | ½ teaspoon black pepper | 2 (7-ounce) packs frozen udon noodles | 1 tablespoon neutral cooking oil | ½ onion, thinly sliced | 3 garlic cloves, sliced | 2 scallions, chopped, white and green parts separated | ½ cup thinly sliced cabbage | ½ carrot, julienned | ½ cup sliced fresh mushrooms | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | ½ teaspoon black pepper | ½ lb sliced beef
directions: Prepare the sauce: Whisk together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, honey, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, and pepper in a bowl. Set aside. | In a medium pot, cook the udon noodles according to package instructions. | Heat the oil in a hot wok or pan over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and scallion whites. Cook until the aromatics are soft, about 2 minutes. Add the cabbage, carrot, and mushrooms. Cook, stirring often, until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the salt and pepper. Transfer the vegetable mixture to a plate. | Add the beef to the wok. Add about 2 tablespoons of the sauce. Cook over medium heat until the beef is mostly browned, about 1 minute. | Add the cooked noodles and vegetable mixture back to the wok. Pour over the rest of the sauce. Cook, stirring very gently so you don't break the noodles, until the sauce absorbs into the noodles, about 3 minutes. | Garnish with the chopped green onions, and serve hot. | Enjoy! | Meal planning made easy with the Tasty app. Download now to see exclusive curated meal plans.

ingredients: 1 lb ground meat (I used pork) | 1 teaspoon kosher salt, divided | 1 teaspoon black pepper, divided | 1.5 tablespoons fish sauce, divided, plus more to taste | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 1 small onion, diced | 4 garlic cloves, minced | 3 ripe roma tomatoes, diced | ½ cup water | 1 cup cherry tomatoes | 1 scallion, sliced | cooked rice, hot
directions: In a bowl, stir together the ground meat, ½ teaspoon of the salt, ½ teaspoon of the black pepper, and ½ tablespoon of the fish sauce. | In a pan over medium heat, add the oil. Add the onion and garlic; cook, stirring occasionally, until aromatic, about 3 minutes. | Add the seasoned meat. Cook over medium heat, using a spatula to break down the meat into smaller chunks, until most of the meat has browned, about 5 minutes. Add the roma tomatoes. Cover and cook until the tomatoes break down, about 2 minutes. Uncover and stir in the water. | Stir in the remaining ½ teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon black pepper, and 1 tablespoon fish sauce. Add the cherry tomatoes, and simmer over medium-low heat, covered, for about 3 minutes, or until the pork is cooked through. | Season to taste with more fish sauce, and garnish with scallions. Serve with a bowl of hot rice. | Enjoy! | Busy? Plan your meals for the week using our exclusive meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download now and get organized.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more for greasing | 2 lb ground beef | 1 medium yellow onion, chopped (plus more for serving) | 4 garlic cloves, chopped | 1 green bell pepper, seeds and ribs removed, chopped | 1 (15-ounce) can black bean, drained | 1 (15-ounce) jar medium salsa (about 1 1/2 cups) | 2 tablespoons taco seasoning | 1 tablespoon ground cumin | 1 tablespoon chili powder | ½ teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste | 8 (8-inch) flour tortillas, cut in half | 2 tomatoes, chopped | 8 oz shredded sharp cheddar cheese | 8 oz shredded Pepper Jack cheese | Toppings: Sour cream, cilantro, green onions or chives, guacamole, sliced jalapeños, pico de gallo
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease a 9 x 13-inch glass or ceramic baking dish. | Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the beef, and cook, stirring often, until browned, 7–8 minutes. Drain the drippings. Add the onion to the skillet, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3–4 minutes, until softened. Add the garlic and bell pepper, and cook, stirring often, until softened, 1–2 minutes.  Stir in the beans, salsa, taco seasoning, cumin, chili powder, and salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 2–3 minutes, until well mixed. Remove from heat. Add more salt to taste. | Layer 6 tortilla halves, half of the beef mixture, half of the tomatoes, and one-third of the cheese in the baking dish. Repeat layers with the remaining tortillas, beef mixture, tomatoes, and cheese on top. | Cover with foil, and bake for 10 minutes. Uncover and bake for 10 more minutes, until the cheese is bubbly. | Let rest for 10 minutes, then slice. Top with sour cream, cilantro, green onions, guacamole, jalapeños, and pico de gallo. | Enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. Download the Tasty app and save your favorites for easy access.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon (4 grams) matcha powder | ¼ cup (40 ml) hot water | ½ cup oat milk | ice
directions: Sift your matcha powder into a ceramic bowl. Add the hot water, and whisk in a W motion until all the matcha is dissolved and bubbles are frothing on top, about 2 minutes. | Add the oat milk. Using a hand whisk, whisk until the matcha mixture is frothy. | Serve immediately over ice. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 10 g mature sourdough starter (10 g) | 100 g whole-wheat flour (100 g), divided | 320 g water (320 g), divided | 300 g bread flour (300 g) | 7 g kosher salt (7 g) | rice flour, for dusting
directions: Place your mature sourdough starter in a bowl, and add 50 grams of the whole-wheat flour and 50 grams of the water (1:5:5 ratio). Mix well, and let it ferment overnight at room temperature (around 75°F) until it doubles in size (this will be your active sourdough starter). | In a large bowl, stir together the bread flour and the remaining 50 grams whole-wheat flour. Add the remaining 270 grams water, and mix using a wooden spoon until all the flour is hydrated. Let this mixture rest for 30 minutes. | Measure out 70 grams of your active sourdough starter, and add it to the dough mixture in the large bowl (reserve the remaining active sourdough starter for the next time you bake). Mix together with your hands until the starter is evenly distributed. Cover the bowl, and let it rest for 30 minutes. | Sprinkle the salt over the dough. Use your hands or a dough scraper to incorporate the salt evenly. Cover the bowl, and let it rest for 30 minutes. | Perform a series of stretches and folds to develop the gluten. To stretch and fold, grab 1 side of the dough, stretch it upwards, and fold it over the center. Repeat this process from all sides of the dough (four folds total). Cover the bowl, and let it rest for 30 minutes. | After the initial stretch and fold, perform a coil fold 3 times every 45 minutes. To make a coil fold, place your hands under the ball of dough. Lift up the dough from the middle, and pull it slightly forward to lift up the front half of the dough from the bowl. Fold the dough down over the front half, tucking the front half under the dough ball. Rotate the dough ball a quarter turn, and repeat. Repeat 2 more times to complete 1 full coil fold around the dough ball. This helps to build strength in the dough. | After 3 rounds of coil folds, let the dough rest until it has visibly risen and increased in volume by 30–50%. This can take 2–3 hours, depending on the temperature of the room. | Gently turn the dough out onto a work surface lightly dusted with rice flour. Shape it into a round or oval loaf, being careful not to deflate it too much. You can use a bench scraper to help shape the dough. | Place the shaped dough, seam side up, into a proofing basket or a bowl lined with a well-floured kitchen towel. Cover with a towel or plastic wrap. Place in the fridge, and let it cold-proof for at least 8 hours or up to 48 hours. | About 45 minutes before baking, preheat your oven to 485°F. Place a Dutch oven or a heavy, lidded pot inside the oven to preheat as well. | Carefully remove the hot Dutch oven from the preheated oven. Turn the proofed dough out, seam side down, into the hot pot. Score the top of the dough with a sharp knife or razor blade. Cover with the lid, and bake for 20 minutes. | Reduce the oven temperature to 435°F. Remove the lid from the Dutch oven, and continue baking for 20–25 minutes, until the bread is deep golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom. Remove the bread from the oven. Let it cool on a wire rack for at least 1 hour before slicing. | Your favorite recipes are just a click away. Download the Tasty app to save and organize your favorites.

ingredients: 4 large egg yolks, room temperature | ½ cup granulated sugar | ¼ cup fresh lemon juice | 1 tablespoon lemon zest | ¼ cup unsalted butter, room temperature | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | 2 cups all-purpose flour | 1.5 teaspoons baking powder | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | Zest of 2 lemons | 1 cup granulated sugar, divided | ¼ cup unsalted butter, softened | 2 large eggs, room temperature | 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice | 1 teaspoon vanilla extract | yellow food coloring, optional | 1 cup confectioners' sugar
directions: Make the lemon curd: In a medium heatproof bowl, combine the yolks, sugar, lemon juice, and lemon zest. Whisk until smooth. | Place the bowl over a pot of simmering water. Cook, stirring continuously with a whisk, until the mixture thickens, about 10 minutes. | Remove from heat, and strain the curd through a fine mesh strainer into a bowl. Add the butter and salt, and whisk until melted and fully incorporated. | Cover the curd with plastic wrap, pressing it directly onto the surface to prevent a skin from forming. Let it cool to room temperature for about an hour, then refrigerate until ready to use. | Make the lemon cookies: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside. | In a separate medium bowl, rub together the lemon zest and ¾ cup of the sugar using your fingertips until the mixture is fragrant and well combined. | Add the softened butter to the sugar mixture. Using a hand mixer, beat on medium speed until combined, 5–7 minutes. Add the eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the lemon juice and vanilla until smooth. | Add 2–3 drops of yellow food coloring if using, and beat until everything is incorporated. | Using a rubber spatula, fold the flour mixture into the egg-butter mixture gently until just combined. The dough will be soft and sticky — this is normal. | Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or up to 24 hours to firm up the dough. | Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. | Scoop about 1 tablespoon dough (approximately 20 grams), and roll into a ball. (You’ll have about 18 balls total.) Roll each ball first in the remaining ¼ cup granulated sugar, then generously in confectioners’ sugar. | Place the coated dough balls on the prepared baking sheets, leaving about 2 inches of space between each. | Use the back of a 1-teaspoon measuring spoon to make an indent in the center of each cookie dough ball. Fill each cookie with about 1 teaspoon lemon curd. | Bake for 10–12 minutes, until the cookies have spread and cracked around the edges and the lemon curd center is slightly set. | Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? ingredients: 1 (15.25-ounce) package red velvet cake mix | 6 tablespoons melted unsalted butter | 2 large eggs | ½ teaspoon lemon zest, optional | ½ cup powdered sugar | ½ tablespoon cornstarch

ingredients: 1 medium sweet potato, unpeeled and cut into ½-inch cubes | 6 oz brussels sprouts, halved | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 1 teaspoon black pepper | ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes | 2 garlic cloves | 1 cup cherry tomatoes | 1 cup panko bread crumbs | ¼ cup freshly grated parmesan cheese | 3 tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary | 3 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme leaves | 3 tablespoons Chopped fresh parsley | 3 tablespoons melted unsalted butter | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 1 lemon, zested, plus lemon juice for serving | 3 garlic cloves, minced | 2 tablespoons dijon mustard | 2 (7-ounce) salmon fillets

ingredients: ½ cup melted unsalted butter | 6 garlic cloves, crushed | 1 tablespoon Chopped fresh parsley | 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes | 1 teaspoon dried oregano | 1.25 teaspoons kosher salt, divided | 2 teaspoons lemon juice, plus more for serving | 2 skin-on salmon fillets (about 1 pound total)s | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1 teaspoon garlic powder
directions: In a small pot, melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in the crushed garlic, parsley, red pepper flakes, oregano, and ¼ teaspoon of the salt. Set the mixture aside to cool. | Line your air fryer with parchment paper, and preheat to 390°F (around 200°C). | Sprinkle the salmon all over with the pepper, garlic powder, and remaining 1 teaspoon salt.
