Whisk continually over medium-low heat until the gravy begins to thicken, about 5 minutes. Set aside and keep warm. | Sauté the veggies: Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Melt the butter and sauté the onions and garlic until tender, about 8 minutes. Add the shiitake and baby bella mushrooms and cook until slightly crispy, about 15 minutes. Add the spinach and cook until wilted, about 3 minutes. Add the green peas, ½ teaspoon McCormick® Thyme Leaves, salt, and McCormick® Ground Black Pepper, and cook for 5 more minutes. | Make the rice mixture: Remove half of the cooked veggies and set aside. Add the cooked wild rice and ¼ cup of the gravy to the skillet and cook for 5 minutes, tossing continuously. | Assemble the bowls: Divide the rice mixture between 4 bowls. Top with the reserved sautéed veggies. Drizzle the gravy over the bowls of rice. Serve immediately. | Enjoy!

ingredients: 2 Thomas’® Cinnamon Raisin Bagels, halved and toasted | 1 cup ricotta cheese | ¼ cup heavy whipping cream | 1.5 tablespoons maple syrup | 1 lemon, zested | 2 teaspoons lemon juice | assorted fresh berry, for topping
directions: In a medium bowl, add the ricotta, heavy whipping cream, maple syrup, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Using a hand mixer on medium-low speed, beat for 2-3 minutes, until light and fluffy. | Spoon the ricotta mixture over each toasted Thomas’® Cinnamon Raisin Bagel. Top with the fresh berries. | Enjoy!

ingredients: 4 Thomas’® Plain Mini Bagels, toasted and halved | 3 large eggs | ¼ cup half-and-half | salt, to taste | freshly ground black pepper, to taste | 1 tablespoon unsalted butter | ⅓ cup olive oil | ¼ cup finely chopped fresh parsley | ¼ cup finely chopped fresh cilantro | ½ lemon, juiced | 1 garlic clove, grated | ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes | ½ teaspoon salt | ¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper | 1 tablespoon olive oil | 1 10-ounce rib eye steak | ½ teaspoon salt | ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
directions: Make the chimichurri: In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, parsley, cilantro, lemon juice, garlic, red pepper flakes, salt, and black pepper. Set aside. | Cook the steak: Place a cast iron skillet or large heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat. Add the olive oil and heat until shimmering. Season the steak on both sides with salt and pepper. Cook the steak in the hot oil for 8 minutes per side, or until it reaches the desired temperature. Let rest for a few minutes, then cut into ½-inch slices, cutting against the grain. Set aside. | Make the scrambled eggs: Whisk together the eggs, half-and-half, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl until well combined. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the butter, swirling to coat the bottom of the skillet. Add the egg mixture and cook, stirring and folding occasionally, for 3-5 minutes, until cooked through. Divide the scrambled eggs into 4 equal portions in the skillet. | Assemble the sandwiches: Top the toasted bottom half of each Thomas’® Plain Mini Bagels with a scrambled egg portion, then top each with 2-3 steak slices. Drizzle each with about 1 tablespoon chimichurri. Cover with the top half of each toasted Thomas’® Plain Mini Bagel. | Enjoy!

ingredients: 3 tablespoons water | 3 tablespoons whole milk | 2 tablespoons bread flour | 2.5 cups bread flour | ½ cup whole milk | ¼ cup sugar | 1 tablespoon instant yeast | 1 teaspoon salt | 1 large egg | 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened | 1 large egg | 1 tablespoon water | 4 tablespoons unsalted butter | 2 tablespoons minced garlic | 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes | 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley | salt, to taste
directions: Make the tangzhong: In a small saucepan over low heat, combine the water, milk, and flour. Whisk until smooth and thickened, about 3-5 minutes. | Make the dough: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a dough hook, add the tangzhong, bread flour, milk, sugar, yeast, salt, and egg. Mix on low speed until a rough ball forms, about 2-3 minutes. | Add the softened butter and mix on medium-low speed until the butter is fully incorporated and an elastic dough forms. This may take up to 15 minutes in a stand mixer. | Shape the dough into a ball and transfer it to a lightly greased bowl. Cover and let it rest and proof for 1½ hours, or until puffy. It may not double in size, which is normal. | Shape the rolls: Once the first proof is complete, divide the dough into 7 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a ball and place them in a greased 9-inch round pan. Cover and proof for 1 hour. For smaller rolls, you can divide the dough into 8 or 9 pieces instead. | Preheat the oven to 375˚F (190˚C). | Make the egg wash by beating the egg and water together in a small bowl. Brush the proofed rolls with the egg wash. | Bake in the oven for 20 minutes, or until the tops are golden brown. | Make the spicy garlic butter: While the rolls are baking, combine the butter, garlic, red pepper, and parsley in a saucepan. Heat over medium heat and let simmer for about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Season with salt to taste. | Once the rolls are done, remove them from the oven and brush with the spicy garlic butter. | Enjoy ASAP! | All your favorite recipes, stored in one place. Download the Tasty app and never lose a recipe again.

ingredients: 1 lb chicken tenderloin | 4 teaspoons smoked paprika, divided | 2 teaspoons garlic powder, divided | 4 tablespoons ranch seasoning, plus more for garnish | 2 cups buttermilk | 1 cup all-purpose flour | 1 teaspoon salt | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1 teaspoon onion powder | canola oil cooking spray
directions: Preheat the air fryer to 350°F (180˚C). | In a large bowl, combine the chicken, 2 teaspoons of smoked paprika, 1 teaspoon of garlic powder, ranch seasoning, and buttermilk. Toss to coat. Let the tenders marinate for at least 30 minutes. | In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, salt, black pepper, onion powder, 2 teaspoons of smoked paprika, and 1 teaspoon of garlic powder. | Working in batches, remove the chicken from the buttermilk and coat it in the seasoned flour mixture, making sure each piece is fully coated and shaking off any excess flour. For extra-crispy tenders, double dredge by dipping the coated chicken tenders back in the buttermilk and then coating them again in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess flour. | Place the chicken tenders in the air fryer basket, making sure they are not overcrowded. Coat the chicken evenly with cooking spray to help achieve a crispy coating. | Carefully transfer the basket to the preheated air fryer and cook the tenders for 15 minutes, or until the chicken is golden and crispy and has reached an internal temperature of 165°F. | Remove from the air fryer and lightly dust with ranch seasoning. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce. | Enjoy! | Don't just wing it -- plan it! Use our meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download here.

ingredients: 1 small orange, peeled | 2 small lemons, peeled | ¼ cup chopped fresh turmeric, (peeling optional) | ¼ cup chopped fresh ginger, (peeling optional) | ⅛ teaspoon fresh black pepper | ½ cup coconut water | ½ cup pineapple juice | 2 teaspoons honey, (adjust to taste) | ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper, (adjust to taste)
directions: Prepare the Ingredients: Start by washing the orange, lemons, turmeric, and ginger. Peel the orange and lemons, and chop the turmeric and ginger into small pieces. Peeling the turmeric and ginger is optional. | Blend Everything: Add the peeled orange, peeled lemons, chopped turmeric, chopped ginger, coconut water, pineapple juice, black pepper, honey, and cayenne pepper to a high-speed blender. | Blend Until Smooth: Blend all the ingredients on high until the mixture is completely smooth. This may take 1-2 minutes, depending on your blender. | Strain: Strain the mixture through a fine mesh strainer or cheesecloth into a bowl. | Serve: Pour the wellness shot into small glass bottles or shot glasses. Store any remaining shots in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. | Shake and Enjoy: Shake well before each use, as the ingredients may settle over time. | Don't let a good recipe slip away. Download the Tasty app and save your favorites for easy access.

ingredients: ½ cup yellow cornmeal | ¾ cup all-purpose flour | 4 tablespoons sugar | 2 teaspoons baking powder | ½ teaspoon salt | 1 teaspoon large egg | ½ cup whole milk | 4 hot dogs, sliced into ½-inch pieces
directions: In a large bowl, combine the cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Stir until well mixed. | In another bowl, whisk together the egg and milk until fully combined. | Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Stir until just combined. The batter will be slightly lumpy which is okay. | Gently fold the hot dog slices into the batter. | Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. | Pour ⅛ cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake, making sure a hot dog piece is in the center. Cook until bubbles form on the surface and the edges begin to set, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through. | Serve warm with your favorite pancake toppings, such as maple syrup, mustard, or ketchup. | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 50 garlic cloves, peeled and ends trimmed | 1 cup extra-virgin olive oil, or more as needed | ½ cup whole milk, room temperature | ½ cup heavy cream, room temperature | 1 large egg, room temperature | 3 cups bread flour, plus more as needed | 2 tablespoons sugar | 3 tablespoons powdered milk | 1 (.25-ounce) envelope instant yeast | 1.5 teaspoons kosher salt | 16 oz Tillamook® Whole Milk Mozzarella cheese, cut into 4 x 1 x 1-inch pieces | egg wash, for brushing | 4 tablespoons melted unsalted butter, for garnish | 1 tablespoon chopped parsley, for garnish | ¼ teaspoon garlic powder, for garnish | flaky sea salt, to taste, for garnish
directions: Preheat the oven to 300°F (148°C). | Make the garlic confit: Place the garlic cloves in a 9-inch loaf pan and cover completely with olive oil. Cover the pan with foil and bake for about 2 hours, or until the garlic cloves are deep golden brown and tender. Set aside to cool. | Make the dough: In the bowl of a stand mixer, combine the milk, cream, egg, flour, sugar, powdered milk, yeast, and salt. Using the dough hook, mix on low speed until evenly combined, about 1 minute. Increase the speed to medium and knead for 10 minutes, or until the dough is smooth, elastic, and cohesive. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let it rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1-2 hours. | Shape the rolls: Punch down the dough to deflate it. Turn it out onto a floured surface and divide it into 8 equal portions. Let the portions rest for 10 minutes to allow the gluten to relax. Then, roll each portion into a 4x9-inch rectangle using a rolling pin. | Spread a few cloves of garlic confit and a piece of cheese over the top third of each dough rectangle. Starting from the top edge with the filling, carefully fold the dough over the cheese and garlic, pressing down to enclose the filling completely. Roll the dough tightly from the top, about halfway down, to form a sealed roll. | Using a knife or bench scraper, cut the remaining exposed dough into ½-inch strips, leaving them connected to the top part of the roll, cutting perpendicular to the roll. Continue to roll the dough to form a striped pattern. | Place the stuffed roll in a greased 9-inch square baking pan, seam side down. Repeat with the remaining rolls until you have 8 in total. | Proof and bake the rolls: Cover the pan with plastic wrap and let the rolls rise for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350˚F (180°C). Once the dough has risen, brush the tops with egg wash and bake for 25-30 minutes. If the tops brown too quickly, loosely tent with foil. | Garnish the rolls: Whisk together the melted butter, parsley, and garlic powder and then immediately brush over top of the hot rolls. Garnish with flaky sea salt. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? Use Botatouille, our AI-powered food genius in the Tasty app. Download here

ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cubed in 1-inch pieces | ¼ cup plain yogurt | 3 tablespoons lemon juice | 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil | 1.5 teaspoons salt | 1 tablespoon garlic paste | 1 teaspoon ginger paste | 1 teaspoon chili powder | 1 teaspoon ground coriander | 1 teaspoon ground cumin | 1 teaspoon paprika | ½ teaspoon curry powder | ½ teaspoon garam masala | ¼ teaspoon ground turmeric | 3 tablespoons unsalted butter | ½ red onion, chopped | 3 garlic cloves, minced | 1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger | 1 teaspoon ground coriander | 1 teaspoon sugar | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | ½ teaspoon chili powder | ½ teaspoon curry powder | ½ teaspoon garam masala | ½ teaspoon ground cumin | ½ teaspoon smoked paprika | ½ teaspoon ground turmeric | ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper, optional | ½ (14.5oz) can diced tomatoes with juice | 2 tablespoons water | ½ cup heavy cream | 1 tablespoon tomato paste | ½ cup mayonnaise | ⅓ cup chopped fresh cilantro | 2 tablespoons lime juice | 2 garlic cloves, minced | ½ teaspoon ground cumin | ⅛ teaspoon kosher salt | 2 tablespoons melted salted butter | 1 garlic clove, minced | 1 teaspoon chopped fresh cilantro | 1 pinch of garlic powder | 1 (12-count) pack Hawaiian sweet rolls, like King's | ¼ red onion, thinly sliced | 2 tablespoons tamarind chutney, optional | 6 slices mild white cheddar cheese | ½ cup shredded mozzarella cheese
directions: Marinate the chicken: In a large bowl, combine the chicken, yogurt, lemon juice, oil, salt, garlic paste, ginger paste, chili powder, coriander, cumin, paprika, curry powder, garam masala, and turmeric. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. | Make the tikka masala sauce: Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the red onion and  sauté until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, ginger, coriander, sugar, salt, chili powder, curry powder, garam masala, cumin, smoked paprika, turmeric, and cayenne if using. Stir and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes and water, then simmer for 4 minutes. Stir in the cream and tomato paste, and simmer for an additional 5 minutes. Blend until smooth. | Cook the chicken: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or foil. Place a wire rack on top of the baking sheet. Remove the chicken from the marinade and arrange it on the wire rack. Broil the chicken on high for 7 minutes per side until charred. Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes, then chop it into smaller pieces. | Make cilantro aioli: In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise, cilantro, lime juice, garlic, cumin, and salt. Set aside for serving. | Make garlic butter: Mix the melted butter with minced garlic, cilantro, and garlic powder. | Preheat the oven to 350°F (180˚C). | To assemble, slice the entire slab of rolls in half horizontally and transfer them to a parchment-lined baking sheet. Spread the tikka masala sauce on both sides of the rolls. | On the bottom half, add the onions, chopped chicken, tamarind chutney (if using),  cheddar, and mozzarella. Cover with the top half of the rolls. Brush with garlic butter. | Bake for 5-7 minutes until the cheese melts. Serve with cilantro aioli for dipping. | Enjoy! | Don't just wing it -- plan it! Use our meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download here.

ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour | ¼ teaspoon salt | ¼ cup powdered sugar | ½ cup unsalted butter, cut into ½-inch cubes and softened at room temperature | ½ teaspoon vanilla extract, optional | 1.5 cups sugar | ⅓ cup all-purpose flour | lemon zest, from 2 lemons | 3 large eggs | ⅓ cup lemon juice, approximately from 2 lemons | powdered sugar, for garnish (optional)
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line an 8-inch square baking dish with parchment paper, making sure the ends extend above the edges of the dish to allow for easy removal. | In a large bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, powdered sugar, and salt for the crust. Add the butter cubes and toss to coat them with the dry ingredients. Add the vanilla extract, if using.. Cut the butter into the flour mixture using a pastry cutter or your hands until the dough is crumbly. | Press the dough into the bottom of the prepared dish. | Bake the crust for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove the pan from the oven to allow it to cool slightly while you make the filling. | In a medium bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and lemon zest. Whisk until well mixed. Add the eggs and lemon juice, and whisk until smooth. For a smoother filling, if desired, strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve before pouring it onto the warm crust. | Bake for the lemon squares for 20 minutes, or until the filling is set. | Let cool in the pan for 20 minutes-1 hour before lifting it out using the parchment paper. If desired, dust with additional powdered sugar. Cut into squares. Lemon squares can be stored in the fridge for up to 3 days. | Enjoy! | Meal planning made easy with the Tasty app. Download now to see exclusive curated meal plans.

ingredients: 8 oz penne pasta, cooked al dente according to package | 1 cup marinara sauce | 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese | 2 jalapeñoes, thinly sliced | 1 8-ounce can pineapple tidbits, drained | ½ cup bacon bits | 8 wooden skewers
directions: Preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. | Carefully place 8-12 pieces of penne pasta on each skewer and lay on the prepared baking sheet. | To each skewer, add a tablespoon of marinara, a generous sprinkle of cheese, 3-4 jalapeños slices, 3-4 pineapple tidbits, and a sprinkle of bacon bits. | Bake for 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted. | Let cool for 2 minutes and serve hot! | Enjoy! | Busy? Plan your meals for the week using our exclusive meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download now and get organized.

ingredients: 1 cup fruit juice | 2 tablespoons honey, maple syrup, or sweetener of choice | 2.5 tablespoons gelatin, or 1.5 teaspoons agar agar | natural food coloring, optional | dropper | silicone worm candy mold
directions: Add the fruit juice to a small saucepan. Heat over low heat until warm, about 2 minutes. | Stir in the honey, maple syrup, or sweetener of your choice. Then whisk in the gelatin over low heat until fully dissolved, about 3 minutes. If using agar agar, whisk and bring mixture to a simmer over low-medium heat until combined well, for about 5 minutes. Allow the mixture to cool 1-2 minutes. | To make a single-color gummy, transfer the mixture to a single bowl. To make multi-colored gummies, divide the mixture among multiple bowls, corresponding to the number of colors desired. Add food coloring to each bowl until the desired color is reached. | To make a single-color gummy, use a dropper to fill the mold. To make multi-colored gummies, use droppers to simultaneously add 2 colors on opposite sides to the silicone mold. Note: If you don’t have a candy mold, you can also use an ice cube tray or pour the mixture into the bottom of a food storage container and cut into cubes once set. | Refrigerate for 15-20 minutes to set before serving. Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 1 week. | Enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. Download the Tasty app and save your favorites for easy access.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons oil, divided | 1 lb ground beef | 1 onion, diced | 3 garlic cloves, minced | 4 serrano peppers, diced | 2 tablespoons chili powder | 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper | 1 teaspoon ground cumin | 1 teaspoon salt | 1 cup amber lager-style beer | 1 15-ounce can Ranch Style Beans with Sliced Jalapeños Peppers | 1 10-ounce can Rotel Tomatoes & Green Chilies | 1 8-ounce can tomato sauce | 4 9.75-ounce bags Fritos Flamin' Hot Corn Chips | 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese | 1 cup spicy queso | sour cream, for garnish (optional) | pico de gallo, for garnish (optional) | 4 pickled serrano peppers, sliced, for garnish (optional) | freshly chopped cilantro, for garnish (optional)
directions: In a large skillet over medium heat, heat 1 tablespoon of oil. Add the ground beef, breaking it into crumbles with a wooden spoon. Cook until browned, about 5-8 minutes. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside. | Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil to the skillet. Add the onion, garlic, and serrano peppers. Cook until the onions are fully translucent, about 5-8 minutes. | Stir in the chili powder, cayenne pepper, cumin, and salt until well combined. | Return the browned beef to the skillet. Pour in the beer and cook until the alcohol has evaporated and the liquid is reduced by half, about 3-5 minutes. | Add the beans, Rotel, and tomato sauce. Bring the mixture to a low simmer. Cover with a lid and let it cook, allowing the sauce to reduce and thicken and the flavors to intensify, about 1 hour. | To assemble, carefully cut along the long side of each Flamin’ Hot Fritos bag to create an opening for serving. Spoon the chili over the Fritos in each bag. Top with shredded cheddar cheese, spicy queso, sour cream, sliced pickled serrano peppers, pico de gallo, and cilantro, if desired. | Enjoy immediately! | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 4 garlic heads | ⅓ cup extra virgin olive oil | kosher salt, to taste | 2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more as needed | 2 teaspoons kosher salt | ¼ cup melted ghee | ½ cup cold water | 1.5 lb russet potato, peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks | 3 tablespoons ghee | 1 tablespoon minced ginger | ½ jalapeño, with seeds (minced) | 1 teaspoon cumin seeds | 1 teaspoon ground coriander | 1.5 teaspoons garam masala | ⅓ cup frozen peas | ¼ cup fresh cilantro, chopped | ½ tablespoon fresh lemon juice | kosher salt, to taste | 2 cups fresh cilantro leaves, packed | 2 cups fresh mint leaves, packed | 1 jalapeño, seeds removed | 1 1-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled | 2 garlic cloves | 1 teaspoon toasted cumin seeds | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 1.5 tablespoons fresh lemon juice | ½ teaspoon sugar | ¼ cup water, plus more as needed | canola oil, for frying
directions: Roast the garlic: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut off the tops of the garlic heads and place them on a large piece of aluminum foil. Drizzle the garlic with olive oil and season with salt. Bring up the corners of the foil around the garlic, then roll closed to form a tight packet. Add the packet to a sheet tray and place in the oven and roast until the garlic is caramelized, about 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and let sit for 15 minutes, until cool enough to handle. | Make the dough: In a large bowl, mix the flour and salt. Add the melted ghee and mix until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Gradually add the cold water, kneading until a smooth, elastic dough forms, about 5 minutes. Wrap the dough tightly in plastic wrap and let sit for at least 30 minutes, until the dough bounces back when pressed. | Make the potato filling: Add the potatoes to a large pot of salted water. Bring to a boil, then reduce and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain and let the potatoes sit in a colander for a few minutes until completely dry. | Heat the ghee in a small nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the ginger and jalapeño; cook until softened, about 2-3 minutes. Add the cumin seeds and cook until fragrant, stirring often, about 2 minutes. Add the coriander and garam masala; cook for 30 more seconds, then remove from the heat. | Transfer cooked potatoes to a large mixing bowl and gently mash with a fork, leaving some large chunks for texture. Pour the hot ghee mixture over the potatoes. Add the roasted garlic, peas, cilantro, lemon juice and ½ teaspoon of kosher salt. Gently stir with a rubber spatula until evenly combined. Set aside to cool to room temperature. | Make the chutney: Combine all ingredients in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth, adding more water as needed to achieve desired consistency. Adjust seasoning with additional salt and lemon juice to taste. Refrigerate until ready to use. | Prepare the dough: Divide the rested dough into 3 equal parts. On a floured surface, roll each ball into a 9-inch circle. Cut each circle into 2 equal halves, resulting in 6 semi-circles. Cover with plastic wrap while working. | Shape the samosas: Take 1 semi-circle and position it with the straight edge facing you. Brush a little water along the straight edge. Bring the left end of the straight edge towards the center, then bring the right end over it, overlapping slightly to form a cone shape. Press gently to seal the edges, ensuring the cone shape is secure. | Hold the cone in your hand and fill it with about ⅓ cup of the roasted garlic potato filling. Use a spoon to gently press the filling into the cone, making sure it is packed but not overfilled. | Brush the open edge of the cone with water. Press the edges together, folding and pinching to ensure the filling is completely enclosed and the seam is tightly sealed. Place the sealed samosa on a plate and cover it with a damp cloth to prevent drying out. | Repeat the shaping, filling, and sealing process with the remaining dough and filling until all the samosas are formed. | Fry the samosas: Heat the canola oil in a large pot to 350°F (175°C). | Carefully place the samosas into the hot oil, a few at a time, being careful not to overcrowd the pan. Fry the samosas until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per side. | Use a slotted spoon to remove the samosas from the oil and drain them on paper towels to remove any excess oil. Repeat with the remaining samosas. | Serve the hot samosas with green chutney on the side for dipping. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? Use Botatouille, our AI-powered food genius in the Tasty app. Download here

ingredients: canola oil, for deep frying | 2 cups all-purpose flour | 3 tablespoons sugar | 1 tablespoon baking powder | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | 2 tablespoons Takis seasoning powder, plus more for garnish | 1 cup whole milk, plus 3 tablespoons (as needed for batter consistency) | 1 large egg | 6 all-beef hot dogs, halved crosswise | 2 (8-ounce) blocks low-moisture mozzarella cheese, cut into rectangles to match the hot dogs | 2 cups panko bread crumbs | 2 cups Takis, crushed | Kewpie Mayo, for serving | deep fry thermometer | 12 wooden skewers
directions: Fill a large stockpot with canola oil and attach a deep-fry thermometer. Heat the oil over medium-high heat until it reaches 350°F (180°C). Adjust the heat to maintain this temperature. Set a wire rack over a baking sheet nearby for draining the fried corn dogs. | In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and Takis seasoning powder. | In a 2-cup liquid measuring cup, whisk together 1 cup of milk and the egg until well combined. | Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk until a thick batter forms. If the batter is too thick to whisk, add more milk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until you reach the desired consistency. Transfer the batter to a tall, narrow container and refrigerate until ready to use. | Thread each hot dog half onto a wooden skewer, cut-side up, pushing it down to about 2 inches below the tip. | Thread mozzarella rectangles onto the skewers above the hot dogs, aligning them with the cut ends. | Place crushed Takis on a small baking sheet or tray. Working one at a time, dip each skewered hot dog and cheese into the batter, coating completely. Shake off excess batter. | Roll the battered corn dogs in the crushed Takis until well coated, using your fingers to press the crumbs on as needed. | Carefully place 2–3 coated corn dogs into the hot oil at a time. Fry for 2–3 minutes, turning as needed, until golden brown and crispy. | Use tongs to transfer the fried corn dogs to the prepared wire rack to drain excess oil. Repeat with remaining corn dogs. | Drizzle with Kewpie mayonnaise and dust with Taki powder. | Enjoy immediately! | Your favorite recipes are just a click away. Download the Tasty app to save and organize your favorites.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon neutral oil | 1 package Johnsonville® Andouille Rope Sausage, sliced into ½-inch rounds | ½ red bell pepper, thinly sliced | ½ green bell pepper, thinly sliced | ½ yellow onion, small diced | 3 garlic cloves, minced | 1 tablespoon cajun seasoning | 1 cup long-grain rice | ¾ cup fire-roasted tomatoes | ¼ cup fire-roasted canned green chilis | 2 cups chicken stock | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | ½ cup thinly sliced scallions, divided, for garnish
directions: In a large skillet over medium heat, add the oil and heat until shimmering. Add the Johnsonville® Andouille Rope Sausage and sauté for about 7 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy. Remove to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. | In the same pot, add the bell peppers and onion and sauté for about 8 minutes, or until tender. Stir in the garlic and Cajun seasoning and cook until fragrant. Add the rice, tomatoes, and green chilis; mix until well combined. Stir in the chicken stock and salt. Cover and cook for 25-30 minutes, until rice is tender. | Remove from the heat and fluff with a fork. Add the cooked sausage and a quarter of the scallions; mix until incorporated. | Divide among individual bowls and garnish with the remaining scallions. | Enjoy!

ingredients: ¼ cup unsalted butter | 2 green apples, peeled and cut into matchsticks | 1 small onion, thinly sliced | 4 cups shredded red cabbage | ¼ cup brown sugar | 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | ¼ teaspoon ground cloves | ¼ teaspoon ground allspice | ¼ cup apple juice | 1 tablespoon lingonberry jam | neutral oil, for greasing | 1 package Johnsonville® Beddar with Cheddar Smoked Sausage, sliced on a 1-inch bias | 1 package Johnsonville® Smoked Rope Sausage, cut into 4-inch pieces and halved lengthwise | olive oil, for drizzling | 4 slices sourdough bread | 4 hard-boiled eggs, quartered | 1 cup cubed Gouda cheese | yellow mustard, for serving | lingonberry jam, for serving
directions: Make the cabbage and apples: In a Dutch oven over medium heat, melt the unsalted butter. Add the apples and onion and sauté for about 10 minutes, or until tender. Add the cabbage and sauté for about 5–7 minutes, or until wilted and tender. Stir in the brown sugar, vinegar, salt, cloves, and allspice; cover and cook for 10 minutes. Add the apple juice and lingonberry jam and cook, uncovered, for 15 minutes, or until the liquid has reduced completely. Set aside. | Prepare the smorgasbord: Cook the Johnsonville® Beddar with Cheddar Smoked Sausage and Johnsonville® Smoked Rope Sausage on the preheated grill pan for 8-10 minutes, until the sausages have curled up and become charred. | Meanwhile, drizzle olive oil over both sides of the bread slices. Grill the bread on the pan on both sides for about 3 minutes total, or until lightly toasted. | Place the toasted bread on a plate and top with the grilled sausages. Serve alongside the boiled eggs, gouda cheese, cabbage and apples, yellow mustard, and lingonberry jam. | Enjoy!

ingredients: 2 (13.25-ounce) packages Johnsonville® Polish Kielbasa, sliced on a bias | 1 lb yellow baby potatoes, quartered | 1 package baby carrots | 1 red onion, halved and quartered | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 2 teaspoons dried thyme | 2 teaspoons kosher salt | 2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper | 1.5 teaspoons onion powder | 1.5 teaspoons garlic powder | 1 teaspoon dried oregano | 1.5 cups beef broth | 2.5 tablespoons all-purpose flour | 2 tablespoons melted unsalted butter | Chopped fresh parsley, for garnish
directions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. | On the prepared baking sheet, combine the Johnsonville® Polish Kielbasa, potatoes, carrots, and onion. Add the olive oil, thyme, salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, and oregano. Toss until the seasonings are evenly distributed. | In a large bowl, whisk together the beef broth, flour, and melted butter until well combined. Pour over the sausage-vegetable mixture. Cover with aluminum foil. | Bake for 50 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender. | Remove from the oven, transfer to a serving plate and garnish with parsley. | Enjoy!

ingredients: 6 russet potatoes, peeled | 4 tablespoons unsalted butter | ¼ cup heavy cream | 2 teaspoons salt, divided | 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil | ½ onion, diced | 4 garlic cloves, minced | 1 red bell pepper, diced | 4 tablespoons tomato paste | 1 lb ground beef | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 2 teaspoons paprika | 1.5 teaspoons ground cumin | ¼ teaspoon ground coriander | ½ tablespoon dried oregano | 3 tablespoons worcestershire sauce | 1.5 tablespoons white vinegar | 2 large eggs, beaten | 1 cup all-purpose flour | 1 cup panko bread crumbs | 2 qt vegetable oil, for frying
directions: Cut the potatoes into chunks and add to a large pot of salted water. Boil over medium-high heat, then cover, reduce to low, and simmer until tender, about 15-20 minutes. | Drain and season with butter, cream, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Mash until smooth. Set aside. | Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.  Add the onion, bell pepper, and garlic. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the tomato paste. | Add the beef, 1 teaspoon of salt, pepper, paprika, cumin, coriander, and oregano. Mix well, breaking up into crumbles. | Add the Worcestershire sauce and vinegar, and cook until no longer pink, about 8-10 minutes. | To shape, spoon a ¼-cup scoop of potatoes into your hand and indent to create a pocket in the middle. Fill the pocket with 1½ teaspoons of beef. Push up the sides of the potato ball to enclose the filling, sealing at the top. If needed, add more potato to cover the beef. Roll the potato in your hands to form a sealed ball. Repeat until all the potato and filling are used, making 12 balls. | Add beaten eggs to a medium bowl. Place flour in one bowl and panko in another. | Roll a ball in flour, shake off excess, dip in beaten egg, let excess drip off, then coat in panko. Repeat for all balls. Place on a large plate and refrigerate for 1 hour. | Add oil to a deep fryer or large pot. Heat to 350˚F (180˚C). | Fry in batches until golden brown, about 3 minutes per batch. | Enjoy! | Don't just wing it -- plan it! Use our meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download here.

ingredients: 12 seedless grapes, washed and dried | 10 Jolly Ranchers, sorted by color for desired coating | 4 wooden skewers
directions: Carefully thread 3 dry grapes on a wooden skewer. Repeat with the remaining skewers. Make sure the grapes are extremely dry so the candy can stick to the skin. | Unwrap the sorted Jolly Ranchers and place them in a microwave-safe cup or bowl. Microwave in 30-second intervals until the candy is bubbly and fully melted. | Dip the grapes into the melted candy, coating it evenly. Place the coated fruit onto a ceramic dish or parchment-lined baking sheet to cool. Allow the candy coating to set and cool completely, about 10-15 minutes at room temperature. | Enjoy! | Meal planning made easy with the Tasty app. Download now to see exclusive curated meal plans.

ingredients: 2 15-ounce cans corn, drained | 1 strip bacon, diced | 2 tablespoons dried shrimp | 1 scallion, sliced | 2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish | 1 tablespoon unsalted butter | salt, to taste | black pepper, to taste | mayonnaise, for garnish (optional) | lime juice, for garnish (optional)
directions: Heat a medium skillet or pan until hot and then add the diced bacon and cook over medium heat until the fat is rendered and the bacon is crispy, about 4 minutes. | Add the corn and stir to coat the kernels in the bacon fat. | Add in the dried shrimp. Top it with a small pat of butter, then add in the scallion and Parmesan. Season with salt and black pepper. Cover to melt the cheese, about 1 minute. | Garnish with mayonnaise, additional Parmesan, and a squeeze of lime. | Enjoy! | Busy? Plan your meals for the week using our exclusive meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download now and get organized.

ingredients: 4 slices prosciutto | 1 large egg | salt, to taste | black pepper, to taste | 1 tablespoon unsalted butter | 1 everything bagel, split | 2 tablespoons cream cheese | ¼ cup microgreens | 2 tomato slices | 8 red onion slices | Sriracha, to taste | ½ avocado, sliced
directions: Heat a small pan over medium heat. Generously spray the pan with nonstick cooking spray. Lay the prosciutto in the pan and cook until crisp, about 1 minute. | Crack an egg in the center of the prosciutto. Top with salt and pepper to taste. | Cover the pan with a lid, and cook for about 2-3 minutes for a slightly runny egg. Adjust cook time accordingly based on your preferred egg doneness. Remove the prosciutto egg from the pan and set aside. | Add a pat of butter to the pan and toast the bagel halves until golden brown and crispy, about 1 minute per side. | To assemble, spread cream cheese on both slices of the bagel, then layer the prosciutto and egg on one slice. | Next, top microgreens and tomatoes. Season the tomatoes with salt and pepper. | Add the red onion slices, sliced avocado, and remaining bagel half. | Enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. Download the Tasty app and save your favorites for easy access.

ingredients: 1 lb ground beef | 1 1-ounce packet taco seasoning | ⅔ cup water | ¼ cup Cholula hot sauce | salt, to taste | 1 teaspoon oil, plus more as needed for frying | 6 12-inch flour tortillas | ¾ cup queso cheese sauce | 6 tostadas | ¾ cup sour cream | 2 cups shredded lettuce | 1 cup diced tomato | 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese | 6 8-inch flour tortillas
directions: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the ground beef, breaking it up with a spoon into crumbles. Cook until no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Drain the grease, then add the taco seasoning, water, and Cholula hot sauce. Simmer for 4-5 minutes. Season with salt to taste. | In another large skillet, heat 1 teaspoon of oil over medium heat. | Place a large tortilla on a cutting board or plate. Spread 2 tablespoons of cheese sauce in the center of the tortilla. | Working quickly, layer with ¼ cup of taco meat, a tostada shell, 2 tablespoons of sour cream, ⅓ cup of shredded lettuce, 2½ tablespoons of tomatoes, and ⅓ cup of shredded cheese. Top with a smaller flour tortilla. | To wrap the crunch wrap, start folding one edge of the large tortilla over the center of the filling. Continue folding the tortilla in small sections, overlapping the folds as you go around, until the entire tortilla is folded over the fillings and forms a sealed disc. | Place the crunch wrap folded side down in the hot skillet. Cook until it turns golden brown, about 2-3 minutes. Flip and toast the other side until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes. | Repeat steps 2-6 to make 5 more crunch wraps. Serve with a side of hot sauce. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 2 russet potatoes, washed and peeled | 1.5 teaspoons kosher salt | 1 teaspoon paprika | ½ teaspoon onion powder | 1 teaspoon garlic powder | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | 1 tablespoon melted unsalted butter | ½ teaspoon dried dill | 3 cups vegetable oil, for frying | 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley | 2 teaspoons chopped fresh chives | flaky sea salt, to taste | 1 tablespoon white vinegar powder
directions: Cut the potatoes into thirds. In a large pot, bring salted water to a boil. Add the potatoes and cook until fork tender, about 6-7 minutes. Drain well and let them cool completely. | Once cooled, shred the potatoes using a grater and transfer them to a large bowl. | Season the potatoes with salt, paprika, onion powder and garlic powder. Add the cornstarch, melted butter, and dill. Mix until well combined. | Form the potato mixture into small tots, about 1½ tablespoons each. You should have about 28 tots. Freeze for 1 hour or until firm. | In a deep skillet or fryer, heat the vegetable oil to 350°F (175°C). | Working in batches, carefully add the tots to the hot oil and fry until golden and crispy, about 3-4 minutes. Transfer the fried tots to a plate lined with paper towels. | Garnish with parsley, chives, flaky sea salt, and white vinegar powder. Serve immediately | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? Use Botatouille, our AI-powered food genius in the Tasty app. Download here

ingredients: 1 ramen packet | 1 all-beef hot dog | 2 bacon strips | 2 large eggs, beaten | 1 slice american cheese | 2 tablespoons shredded mozzarella cheese | 2.5 tablespoons corn | 1 green onion, sliced | salt, to taste | black pepper, to taste | Sriracha, to taste | Kewpie Mayo, for garnish | furikake, for garnish
directions: Cook ramen per packet instructions. Drain well and set aside. | Wrap the hot dog with the two strips of bacon. Add the hot dog to a pan over medium heat. Cover and cook for about 4 minutes or until bacon is cooked and slightly charred. Remove and set aside. | Generously spray the pan with nonstick cooking spray. Add the cooked ramen, spreading the noodles evenly in the pan. | Pour the eggs over the noodles and swirl to coat the bottom of the pan. Top with American cheese, bacon-wrapped hot dog, mozzarella cheese, corn, and green onion. Season to taste with salt, pepper, and Sriracha. | Cover and cook over medium heat for 2 minutes, or until the eggs are set. Fold the omelet. | Drizzle with Kewpie mayo, Sriracha, and furikake for garnish. | Enjoy! | Your favorite recipes are just a click away. Download the Tasty app to save and organize your favorites.

ingredients: 2 slices italian bread | ½ cup whole milk | ½ lb lean ground beef | ½ lb mild italian pork sausage, loose | 1 large egg | 2 garlic cloves, grated | ½ cup grated parmesan cheese | 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley | 1.5 teaspoons kosher salt | 1 (32 oz) jar marinara sauce
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. | Tear the Italian bread into large pieces and place them in a bowl. Pour the milk over the bread and let it soak for about 5 minutes, or until the bread is fully saturated. | In a large mixing bowl, combine the soaked bread (squeezing out any excess milk), ground beef, Italian pork sausage, garlic, egg, Parmesan cheese, parsley, and kosher salt. Mix gently with your hands until all the ingredients are well incorporated. Be careful not to overmix, as this can make the meatballs tough. | Using your hands, form the meat mixture into 1½-inch balls and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. You should have about 12 meatballs. | Bake the meatballs in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are just starting to brown but are not fully cooked through. | While the meatballs are in the oven, heat your marinara sauce in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat. Once the meatballs are par-cooked, transfer them to the simmering sauce. Cover and cook for at least 30 minutes but up to a few hours until meatballs are tender and moist. | Serve the meatballs with your favorite cooked pasta and some more freshly grated parmesan cheese. | Enjoy! | Hate losing that perfect recipe? Save and organize recipes easily on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 1 pineapple | 15 garlic cloves, chopped | 1 tablespoon neutral oil | 3 scallions, chopped (divided) | 2 cups cooked white rice, cold | kosher salt, to taste | ½ teaspoon black pepper, optional | 2 teaspoons light soy sauce | 1 teaspoon dark soy sauce | red thai chile, for garnish
directions: Cut the pineapple: Lay the pineapple on its side on a cutting board. Cut it in half through the crown to create two halves. On the inside of one half, use a knife to carefully score a 1-inch border around the edge. Score the pineapple flesh inside the border in a grid pattern, making parallel cuts horizontally and vertically. Use a spoon to scoop out the pineapple, being careful not to pierce the outer skin. Leave about a 1-inch border to form the bowl. Repeat with the other half. Reserve the pineapple chunks and the bowls. | Infuse the oil: In a wok or large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the chopped garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, until light golden brown. Remove the garlic, leaving the garlic-infused oil in the pan. | Sauté scallions: Add 2 chopped scallions to the wok and sauté for 15-30 seconds until fragrant. | Fry the rice: Turn the heat to high and add the rice. Stir to separate the grains and cook for 3-4 minutes until the rice is relatively dry. | Season the rice: Season with salt, pepper (if using), and both soy sauces. Mix well to combine. Add the reserved fried garlic and pineapple chunks to the rice and mix. Divide the mixture between the 2 pineapple bowls. | Garnish with the remaining chopped scallion and red Thai chilies. | Enjoy! | Love this recipe? Download the Tasty app to save it and discover others like it.

ingredients: 3 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs | 4 teaspoons smoked paprika, divided | 4 teaspoons garlic powder, divided | 4 tablespoons jerk seasoning | 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided (plus more for drizzling) | 1 lb dried lasagna noodles | 1 small green bell pepper, diced | 1 red bell pepper, diced | 4 garlic cloves, minced | ½ small red onion, diced | 1 tablespoon unsalted butter | 3 cups heavy cream | 6 oz shredded parmesan cheese | 16 oz shredded mozzarella cheese
directions: In a large bowl combine the chicken thighs with 2 teaspoons of smoked paprika, 2 teaspoons of garlic powder, 2 tablespoons of jerk seasoning, and 1 tablespoon of olive oil. | Cook the lasagna noodles al dente, according to the package. Drain, lay them flat, and drizzle with oil to prevent sticking. | Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet on medium heat. Once the oil is hot. add the chicken and cook until charred and internal reaches 165°F. Remove and rest on a cutting board. | In the same skillet add butter, diced bell peppers, garlic, and onions. Cook, stirring occasionally until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes. | Add the cream, 2 tablespoons of jerk seasoning, 2 teaspoons of smoked paprika, and 2 teaspoons of garlic powder. Mix well and simmer for 3 minutes. Stir in the Parmesan cheese and continue to simmer until the sauce thickens, about 8-10 minutes. | Meanwhile, dice the chicken into small pieces. | Preheat the oven to 375˚F (190˚C). | To build the rolls, spread a layer of creamy jerk sauce on each noodle, then add chicken and mozzarella. Gently roll the noodle and place it in a baking dish. Repeat the process until all the noodles are used. | Top the rolls with sauce and mozzarella. Bake for 20 minutes until the top is golden brown. | Enjoy! | Don't just wing it -- plan it! Use our meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download here.

ingredients: 1 1-pound steak | 1 teaspoon salt | 1.5 teaspoons black pepper | 1 teaspoon garlic powder | 2 tablespoons oil | 3 tablespoons unsalted butter | 1 sprig fresh rosemary | 1 sprig fresh sage | 5 cloves garlic cloves, peeled | flaky sea salt, to garnish
directions: Season the steak with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. For best results, place it on a wire rack over a baking sheet and refrigerate uncovered, ideally overnight. | An hour before cooking, remove the steaks from the fridge and let them sit at room temperature to ensure even cooking. | In a heavy-duty pan, preferably a cast iron skillet, heat the oil on high until it begins to smoke. | Add the steak to the pan and do not move it! Let it sear on one side for 30 seconds. Press down with a weight or spatula to ensure maximum contact between the steak and the pan. | Flip the steak after 30 seconds and continue flipping every 30 seconds until 2 minutes have passed. Then add the butter, rosemary, sage, and garlic. | Start basting the steak while flipping every 30 seconds for an additional 2 minutes. Check the steak’s temperature and remove it from the heat when it is 10 degrees below your desired doneness.. | Rest the steak for 10-15 minutes, then slice and finish with some flaky salt. | Enjoy! | All your favorite recipes, stored in one place. Download the Tasty app and never lose a recipe again.

ingredients: 2 grapefruits | 2 cups heavy cream | 1 cup sugar, for the custard | 4 teaspoons sugar, divided (for the topping)
directions: Slice 1 grapefruit in half, crosswise. | Use a paring knife to cut around the pulp of the grapefruit without piercing the skin. Then, use a metal spoon to scoop out the grapefruit pulp. | Juice the grapefruit pulp and set it aside. You should have about ½ cup of grapefruit juice. | In a small pot, combine heavy cream and sugar. Bring the mixture to a light boil, then remove from heat. | Add the grapefruit juice, then zest the remaining grapefruit over the pot and whisk to combine. | Let the mixture cool for 10 minutes. | Pour the mixture back into the halved grapefruit. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. | To brûlée the grapefruit, sprinkle 2 teaspoons of granulated sugar on the top of each posset. Use a kitchen torch and torch the top of the sugar until melted and caramelized. | Enjoy! | Meal planning made easy with the Tasty app. Download now to see exclusive curated meal plans.

recipe_name: This recipe is exclusively available in the Tasty app.

ingredients: 1 can crescent roll dough | 2 chocolate bars, broken into small pieces | 12 cinnamon bear cookies | 1 banana, peeled and sliced into 12 slices | 3 tablespoons melted unsalted butter | ¼ cup sugar | 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
directions: Roll out crescent roll dough and use your fingers to press the seams together. Cut into 12 2 x 4-inch strips. | At the top of a dough strip, place a piece of chocolate, a banana slice on top of it, and finally a bear cookie. Fold the remainder of the strip over the bear up to his head like you're tucking him into bed. Use a fork to press down the seams. | Combine the sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl. Brush the dough with melted butter and sprinkle with the cinnamon sugar. | Air fry for 5 minutes at 350ºF (180˚C). Let cool for 2 minutes or until cool enough to touch. | Enjoy while still warm! | All your favorite recipes, stored in one place. Download the Tasty app and never lose a recipe again.

recipe_name: This recipe is exclusively available in the Tasty app.

ingredients: 12 chocolate sandwich cookies | 3 tablespoons melted salted butter | 2 teaspoons unflavored gelatin powder | ½ cup boiling water | 12 oz cream cheese, softened | ⅔ cup heavy whipping cream | 2 tablespoons sugar | 2 tablespoons coffee liqueur | 1 tablespoon instant coffee | 2 tablespoons melted semi-sweet chocolate | dark chocolate shaving, for decorating | 4 coffee beans, for decorating
directions: For the cookie crust, add the chocolate cookies and melted butter to a food processor. Pulse for 30 seconds, or until the mixture reaches a sandy consistency. Set aside. | In a heat-safe bowl, dissolve the gelatin powder in boiling water. Mix until fully dissolved, ensuring there are no clumps. | For the filling, add the cream cheese, cream, sugar, coffee liqueur, instant coffee, melted chocolate, and gelatin mixture to a blender. Blend for 60 seconds, or until smooth. | Divide the cookie crust among 4 martini glasses. Press the crust against the sides of each glass with a spoon. | Pour the cheesecake filling into each glass and refrigerate for 3-4 hours, or until the cheesecake is set. | Decorate the cheesecakes with dark chocolate shavings and coffee beans. | Enjoy! | Busy? Plan your meals for the week using our exclusive meal planner tool in the Tasty app. Download now and get organized.

ingredients: 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil | ½ teaspoon cumin seeds | ⅓ cup finely chopped onion | 1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger | 6 cloves garlic, minced | ½ teaspoon ground cumin | ½ teaspoon ground coriander | ½ teaspoon ground turmeric | ¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | ½ teaspoon curry powder | 1 teaspoon garam masala | 2 large red potatoes, chopped (about 2 cups) | 2 tablespoons water | 1 cup frozen peas and carrots, thawed | 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro | 8 pre-made parathas | vegetable oil, for frying | tamarind sauce, for serving | mint chutney, for serving
directions: Prepare the filling: Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds, onion, ginger, and garlic. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the onion is translucent. | Stir in ground cumin, coriander, turmeric, red pepper, kosher salt, curry powder, and garam masala. Cook for about 1 minute. Add the potatoes and water. Cover and cook on medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are soft, about 10 minutes. | Add the peas and carrots and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in chopped cilantro, and let the filling cool. | Assemble the samosas: Cut each paratha in half. Moisten the straight edge of one half with a little water to help it stick together. Fold the straight edge over to form a cone, pressing the edges to seal. | Fill the cone with 1-2 tablespoons of the potato filling. Apply water around the open edge of the cone and press together to seal, forming a filled triangle. Repeat with remaining dough and filling. | Fry the samosas: Heat vegetable oil in a deep saucepan over medium heat to 325°F (163°C). Fry 4 samosas per batch, until golden brown, about 8 minutes per batch. Remove and drain on a paper towel. | Serve hot with tamarind sauce or mint chutney for dipping. | Enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. Download the Tasty app and save your favorites for easy access.

ingredients: 1 banana, peeled (or ½ cup applesauce) | 1 large egg | 1.25 cups milk of choice | ¼ cup almond butter, or any nut butter | ¼ cup maple syrup, or more to taste for a sweeter version | ¼ cup melted unsalted butter | 1 teaspoon vanilla extract | 1 teaspoon baking powder | 1.5 teaspoons ground cinnamon | ½ teaspoon salt | 2 cups rolled oats | 1 cup diced peaches | 1 teaspoon brown sugar, or a substitute sweetener like brown monkfruit sweetener | vanilla yogurt or whipped cream, for garnish | diced peach, for garnish
directions: Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C). | In a medium bowl, mash banana or add the applesauce if using instead. Whisk in an egg. Add milk, almond butter or nut butter, maple syrup, butter, vanilla and stir to combine. | Mix in baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. | Stir in rolled oats and diced peaches. | Evenly spread the mixture in a 9-inch square baking dish. | Sprinkle brown sugar or substitute sweetener of choice evenly over the top. | Bake for 40 minutes, or until edges are golden brown and middle is cooked through. | Garnish with vanilla yogurt or whipped cream and diced peaches before serving. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: 1 lb spaghetti | 1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined | ½ tablespoon salt | ½ tablespoon black pepper | ½ tablespoon paprika | ½ tablespoon garlic powder | 4 tablespoons unsalted butter | 2 scallions, sliced | 20 cloves garlic, minced | ¼ cup shallots, minced | 2 tablespoons oyster sauce | 1 tablespoon soy sauce | 1 tablespoon fish sauce | ½ tablespoon sugar | ¼ cup shaved parmesan cheese
directions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Save ¼ cup (60 ml) of pasta water, then drain. | In a large bowl, combine the shrimp with salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder. Set aside. | In a hot wok, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Add in the scallions, garlic, and shallots. Stir fry until fragrant, about 1 minute. | Add in the shrimp, and stir fry, until pink and opaque, about 4 minutes. | Stir in the oyster sauce, soy sauce, sugar, and fish sauce. | Toss in the cooked spaghetti. Mix until well coated. If the sauce seems dry, add the pasta water as needed until the desired consistency is reached. Top with shaved Parmesan. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? Use Botatouille, our AI-powered food genius in the Tasty app. Download here

recipe_name: Miso Red Curry Soup Dumpling Soup
ingredients: 2 garlic cloves, minced | 3 tablespoons shallots, minced | 1 scallion, sliced | 2 cups bone broth | ½ tablespoon miso paste | 2 teaspoons red curry paste | 1 teaspoon soy sauce | ½ teaspoon fish sauce | ½ teaspoon sugar | 10 frozen soup dumplings | sliced scallion, for garnish | black sesame seed, for garnish | chili oil, for garnish
directions: In a hot pan on medium heat, sauté the garlic, shallots, and scallion until fragrant, about 1 minute. | To the pan add the broth, and bring it to a simmer, about 3 minutes. | Stir in the miso paste until melted and fully incorporated. Stir in the red curry paste until melted and fully incorporated. Season with soy sauce, fish sauce, and sugar. | Plop in the frozen soup dumplings and cover. Let simmer on medium heat for 10 minutes or until cooked through. Be sure to gently shake the pan about half way through the cooking time to ensure that the soup dumplings don't stick to the bottom of the pan. | Serve with scallions, sesame seeds, and extra chili oil! | Enjoy! | Your favorite recipes are just a click away. Download the Tasty app to save and organize your favorites.

ingredients: 1 cup yogurt | 3 tablespoons nut butter of choice, (or nut-free version) | 2 tablespoons maple syrup | 1 teaspoon vanilla extract | ¼ cup mini chocolate chips | ½ cup cookie dough bits, (from recipe below) | 1 cup chocolate chips | 1 tablespoon coconut oil | 1 cup almond flour | ½ cup butter, softened (may use nut butter) | ¼ cup brown sugar, (may use sugar, coconut sugar or monkfruit sweetener) | ½ teaspoon vanilla extract | ¼ cup mini chocolate chips | ½ teaspoon salt, optional | 2 tablespoons milk, if needed, to thin
directions: Make yogurt pops: Line a cutting board with parchment paper. | In a medium bowl mix together yogurt, nut butter, maple syrup, vanilla, salt and chocolate chips. | Make cookie dough bits: In a separate large mixing bowl or standing mixer, add butter and sugar and beat until combined. Then add vanilla, almond flour, and chocolate chips. | Mix until combined and either form into small cookie dough balls or roll dough out and chop into bits. | Fold ½ cup of the cookie dough bits into the bowl with yogurt mixture. | Add dollops of the yogurt mixture to the parchment paper lined cutting board, stick popsicle sticks in each and freeze until set, at least 2 hours. | To a small saucepan or double broiler add chocolate chips and coconut oil over low heat, stirring constantly until melted. | Dip frozen yogurt pops in melted chocolate or drizzle on top. | Important note: do not eat raw all-purpose flour (unless properly heat treated.) For the edible cookie dough, use almond flour or add oats to a food processor and pulse until you reach a fine oat flour. | Store remaining cookie dough in an air-tight container in the fridge for up to 10 days or freeze! | Enjoy! | Love this recipe? Download the Tasty app to save it and discover others like it.

ingredients: 2 teaspoons sea salt | 2 teaspoons vinegar | 6 eggs | rice, for serving | dried seaweed, for garnish | ½ cup soy sauce | ½ cup water | ¼ cup honey | ¼ cup diced onion | 2 red chilis, sliced | 1 green onion, diced | 4 garlic cloves, minced | 1 tablespoon sesame seeds | 2 lemon slices, cut in quarters
directions: Fill a pot halfway with water. Bring to a boil and add salt, vinegar, and the eggs. Cook for 6 minutes, then immediately remove eggs and add to an ice bath. | In a large bowl, combine the marinade ingredients. | Add your eggs to the marinade, top with lemon slices, then refrigerate overnight. | The next day, serve with some cooked rice and garnish with seaweed. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes? Use Botatouille, our AI-powered food genius in the Tasty app. Download here

ingredients: 4 lb shrimp, cleaned deveined | 2 tablespoons oyster sauce | 1 teaspoon sesame oil | 5 garlic cloves, minced | 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, grated | 2 teaspoons onion powder | 1 tablespoon all-purpose seafood seasoning | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1 cup flour | 2 eggs, beated | 2 cups panko breadcrumbs | sesame seed, for garnish | scallion stalk, chopped, for garnish | 48 fl oz vegetable oil, for frying | 1 cup kewpie mayonnaise | ½ cup sweet chili sauce | 1 tablespoon sriracha sauce | 1 lime, juiced
directions: Chop the shrimp until it's paste-like. This can also be done in a food processor. | Transfer the chopped shrimp to a large mixing bowl. Add grated ginger, minced garlic, onion powder, all purpose seafood seasoning, oyster sauce, sesame oil,black pepper and mix together until well combined. | Form the shrimp mixture into the size of a tennis ball then coat in flour, egg, and panko breadcrumbs. | Use your finger to make a hole in the middle creating the shape of a donut and freeze for 30 minutes. | In a bowl combine kewpie mayo, sweet chili , sriracha, and lime juice mix well and set aside. | Fry the shrimp donuts at 325°F for 10 minutes. | Place donuts on a plate lined with a paper towel to drain any excess oil. | Serve with bang bang sauce and garnish with black sesame seeds, and scallions. | Enjoy! | All your favorite recipes, stored in one place. ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil | 1 small yellow onion, finely chopped | 2 garlic cloves, minced | 2 tablespoons tomato paste | 1 red bell pepper, finely chopped | 1 (14-ounce) can diced tomatoes, or 2 cups fresh peeled tomatoes | 1 teaspoon ground cumin | 1 teaspoon paprika | ½ teaspoon red chili flakes | ¼ teaspoon chili powder | 2 teaspoons garlic powder | 1 tablespoon fish sauce | salt and pepper, to taste | 4 large eggs | ¼ cup crumbled feta cheese | fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish | crusty bread, for serving

Cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes. | Add in the diced red peppers, tomato paste, cumin, chili powder, paprika, red pepper flakes, garlic powder, salt and pepperCook for another minute until fragrant. | Pour in the diced tomatoes andfish sauce.. ingredients: 1 cup red dragon fruit, peeled and chopped | 1 tablespoon granulated sugar | 1 tablespoon lemon juice | 1 cup water, divided | 3 (.25-ounce) envelopes unflavored gelatins | 1.5 cups granulated sugar | 1 cup light corn syrup | confectioners' sugar, for dusting
directions: In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine diced dragon fruit, granulated sugar, and lemon juice. Stir until sugar is dissolved. When the mixture boils, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until mixture is thickened and jammy. | Pour compote into a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Then set aside to cool. | Grease a 9x9-inch baking pan with cooking spray and set aside. | In the bowl of a stand mixer, stir together dragon fruit compote and 1⁄2 cup cold water. Sprinkle gelatin on top and let it bloom for 5 minutes until gelatin is dissolved. | In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine granulated sugar, corn syrup and remaining ½ cup water. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Bring the mixture to a boil, swirling the pan occasionally, until the mixture reaches exactly 240°F (115°C) on a candy thermometer, about 10-12 minutes. Immediately remove from heat. | With the stand mixer on low speed, slowly pour the melted sugar mixture into the gelatin mixture. Slowly, increase the speed to high and whip until the mixture is stiff and light pink, about 7 to 10 minutes. When you remove the whisk, stiff peaks should form. Working quickly, pour the mixture into the prepared baking pan and use a spatula to spread evenly. | Let the marshmallows sit for at least 4 hours at room temperature until firm. | Sprinkle your work surface with confectioner's sugar. Use a butter knife to slice around the edges of the pan, then turn the marshmallow out onto the work surface. Use a sharp knife to cut the marshmallow into 12 squares. If needed, spray the knife with cooking spray to help prevent sticking. | Toss each marshmallow in confectioner's sugar on each side to prevent sticking, then serve and enjoy! | Love this recipe? recipe_name: Air Fryer Mango Thai Chicken Wings
ingredients: 1.5 lb chicken wings | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | 1 teaspoon baking powder | 1 teaspoon garlic powder | 1 teaspoon onion powder | 1 teaspoon paprika | ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper | 2 large mangoes, peeled, pitted, and coarsely chopped | 10 red thai chiles | ½ cup water | 2 garlic cloves | 4 tablespoons honey | ½ teaspoon kosher salt | 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cold | scallion, sliced, for garnish | red thai chile, minced, for garnish | fresh lime juice, for garnish

Use an immersion blender to blend until smooth. Place the pot over medium heat and cook for 5 minutes. Whisk in the butter and continue cooking until the sauce is thickened, about 2 to 3 minutes. Flip the chicken wings and continue air frying for 8 minutes, or until the skin is golden brown and crispy. | Transfer the cooked wings to a bowl and toss with mango sauce. | Add to a serving plate and garnish with scallions, fresh chiles and a squeeze of lime juice. | Enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. ingredients: 4 oz cream cheese, room temperature | 4 Thomas’® Everything Bagels, toasted and halved | 2 cups arugula | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 4 large eggs | salt, to taste | freshly ground black pepper, to taste | 5 jarred roasted red peppers | ½ cup olive oil | ½ cup toasted blanched almonds | ⅓ cup fire-roasted canned tomatoes | ¼ cup fresh parsley leaves | ¼ cup toasted blanched hazelnuts | ½ lemon, juiced | 2 garlic cloves, peeled | 1 teaspoon red wine vinegar | 1 teaspoon salt | ½ teaspoon smoked paprika | ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes

Fry the eggs for 6-7 minutes, until whites are cooked through and yolks are still runny. Season with salt and black pepper. | Place a fried egg on top of the arugula for each sandwich. Spoon 1-2 tablespoons of the romesco sauce over each fried egg. Cover with the top half of each toasted Thomas’® Everything Bagel. | Enjoy!

ingredients: unsalted butter, for greasing | 2 Thomas’® Plain Bagels, cut into ½-inch cubes | 2 large peaches, cut into ½-inch cubes | 1.25 cups half-and-half | 4 large eggs | ½ cup sugar | 1 teaspoon vanilla extract | 1 teaspoon cinnamon | ½ teaspoon nutmeg | powdered sugar, for garnish
directions: Grease 4 (7-ounce) ramekins with butter. | Place half of the cubed Thomas’® Plain Bagels into the bottom of the prepared ramekins. Top with half of the cubed peaches. Repeat the layers once more with the remaining cubed Thomas’® Plain Bagels and peaches. | In a medium bowl, whisk together the half-and-half, eggs, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg until well combined. Divide evenly amongst the 4 ramekins, then press the bread pudding down so the liquid is absorbed properly. | Place the filled ramekins onto a sheet tray and let chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours or overnight. | Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). | Bake the bread puddings on the sheet tray for 25-30 minutes, until the tops are golden brown and spring back when lightly pressed. Allow to cool for 10 minutes. | Dust the tops with powdered sugar, and enjoy warm!

ingredients: 1 cup warm milk, (115°F) | ⅕ teaspoon instant dry yeast | 2 large eggs, room temperature | ½ cup salted butter, room temperature | 1 teaspoon kosher salt | ½ teaspoon cinnamon | ½ cup cane sugar | 4 cups all-purpose flour | 4 peaches, diced | ¼ cup dark brown sugar, + 2 tbsp | 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon | 1 teaspoon vanilla paste | 1 teaspoon cornstarch, + 2 tsp water | ½ lemon, juiced | ¾ cup salted butter, melted and cooled | ⅕ cup dark brown sugar | 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon | 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg | ½ cup heavy cream, to top off rolls before baking | ½ cup salted butter, melted | ⅔ cup dark brown sugar | 1 cup all-purpose flour, + 2 tbsp | ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon | ¹⁄₁₆ teaspoon kosher salt | 8 oz cream cheese, softened | ½ cup salted butter, room temperature | 2 cups powdered sugar | 1 teaspoon vanilla | ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
directions: Make the Dough: Add warm milk and yeast to a stand mixer bowl. | Add eggs, softened butter, salt, cinnamon, and cane sugar to the mixture and mix until evenly combined. | Add the flour and mix until combined using the paddle attachment for 1-2 minutes. Let the dough rest for about 5 minutes. | Attach the dough hook and mix for about 5 minutes on setting 1. The dough should be slightly sticky; if too sticky, add flour a tablespoon at a time, no more than 3 tbsp. | Grease a large mixing bowl with butter, transfer the dough to the greased bowl, cover, and let it double in size, about 45-60 minutes in a warm kitchen. | Prepare the Peach Filling: In a saucepan, combine diced peaches, brown sugar, lemon juice, and cinnamon. Cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes until bubbly. | Mix cornstarch and water, stir into the peach mixture, and cook for 1 minute until thickened. Remove from heat, stir in vanilla paste, and chill. Reserve ½ cup for topping. | Make the Filling: In a bowl, mix cooled melted butter, brown sugar, nutmeg, and cinnamon until well combined. Set aside. | Assemble the Rolls: After the dough has doubled in size, sprinkle flour on a clean surface and roll out the dough to about 12x24 inches. | Spread the butter-cinnamon mixture evenly over the dough using a rubber spatula. Add dollops of peach topping, reserving ½ cup for the final topping. | Slice strips from the long side of the dough that are about 1 ¾-inches thick. Roll each strip into a roll and place in a greased 12x16 baking pan. Let the rolls rise again for about 35 minutes until doubled in size. | Prepare the Cinnamon Streusel: Combine melted butter, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl. Spread on a parchment-lined tray and bake at 350°F for 8 minutes. Let cool. | Bake the Rolls: Pour heavy cream over the risen rolls, ensuring it seeps between them for moisture. Sprinkle a tablespoon of the streusel over the rolls, reserving the rest for topping. | Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes, checking to ensure the center and sides are cooked. | Prepare the Frosting: In a stand mixer, beat cream cheese and softened butter until smooth. | Gradually add powdered sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon, and mix until well combined. For a glaze-like consistency, add 2 tablespoons of milk and mix well. Set aside. | Once baked, frost the warm rolls with the prepared cream cheese frosting. | Top each roll with the reserved chilled peach filling and a sprinkle of the remaining streusel. | Store in an airtight container in the fridge for 2-3 days. Reheat gently before serving. | Enjoy! | Cook smarter, not harder. Use our AI chef Botatouille on the Tasty app. Download now.

ingredients: ¼ cup water | 1 cup granulated sugar | ½ cup peach nectar | 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, cold | 1 teaspoon kosher salt

Stir in the salt and continue cooking until the caramel thickens and reaches 235°F (113°C), about 2 minutes. | Remove caramel from the heat and allow it to slightly cool down before using. ingredients: 1 (16.3-ounce) can Pillsbury Grands!™ Flaky Layers Biscuits | 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted | ½ cup granulated sugar | 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon | 1 cup powdered sugar, or more as needed | ¼ cup dehydrated strawberries, or any freeze-dried fruit you like (optional: blend until finely ground for a smoother texture) | 1 tablespoon milk, or heavy cream, more as needed | ½ teaspoon vanilla extract

In a small bowl, mix together the sugar and cinnamon until well combined; sprinkle over the donuts and mix until evenly coated. | Make the dip: In a medium bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar, dehydrated strawberries, milk, and vanilla until smooth. Add more milk to reach the desired consistency. If you want a thicker consistency, sprinkle in a bit more powdered sugar. | Serve the warm donuts with the dip. | Enjoy! | Don't let a good recipe slip away. ingredients: 1 (.25-ounce) envelopes unflavored gelatin | 2 tablespoons cold water | 1 cup boiling water | ½ (14-ounce) can sweetened condensed milk | 1 (.25-ounce) envelopes unflavored gelatin | 2 tablespoons cold water | 2 tablespoons instant coffee | 1.5 cups boiling water | ¼ cup granulated sugar | caramel sauce, for garnish | chocolate sprinkle, for garnish | silicone donut pan
directions: Make the milk jelly: Add gelatin and cold water to a small bowl. Stir to combine then let sit for 5 minutes until the water is absorbed and gelatin is thickened. | Mix the boiling hot water and bloomed gelatin and stir until fully dissolved. Add the sweetened condensed milk and stir until evenly combined. | Pour the milk jelly into the silicone donut molds, only filling about halfway. Transfer to the fridge and let set until firm, about 1 hour. | Make the coffee jelly: Add gelatin and cold water to a small bowl. Stir to combine then let sit for 5 minutes until the water is absorbed and gelatin is thickened. | Mix the instant coffee and sugar with boiling hot water in a bowl. Add the bloomed gelatin and whisk until fully dissolved. | Let cool slightly until cool to the touch (to prevent melting the first layer), then pour over milk jelly filling the molds completely. Place in the refrigerator overnight until fully set, about 2 to 3 hours. | Carefully unmold and garnish each donut with caramel sauce and chocolate sprinkles. | Enjoy! | Busy? ingredients: 2 cups kataifi (shredded phyllo dough), cut into small pieces | 3 tablespoons ghee, or clarified butter, for frying | 2 cups strawberry, hulled and halved | 2 tablespoons sugar | ½ teaspoon lemon juice | ½ cup strawberry jam, additional to the puree, for layering | 8 oz cream cheese, softened | 3 tablespoons powdered sugar | ½ cup strawberry puree | 1 teaspoon vanilla bean paste | 3 cups white chocolate, melted
directions: Prepare the Kataifi: Heat ghee in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the shredded phyllo and fry until golden and crispy for about 8-10 mins. Use a slotted spoon to remove and drain on a paper towel. | Make the strawberry puree: Place the strawberries, sugar, and lemon juice in the bowl of a food processor or blender. Blend until smooth. | Pour the strawberry puree into a saucepan. Cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the puree thickens to your desired consistency. | Let the puree cool before using it in your recipes. Store any leftover puree in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week. | Make the Strawberry Cream Cheese Filling: In a mixing bowl, blend the cream cheese, powdered sugar, strawberry puree (or jam), and vanilla paste until smooth. | Add the fried kataifi to the strawberry cream cheese mixture and mix until well combined. | Prepare Chocolate Molds: If desired, drizzle a light layer of melted chocolate into the molds and let set in the fridge for about 8 minutes. Add more melted chocolate to the mold, allowing any excess to drip off, then put it back in the fridge for about 10 minutes or until it sets. | Fill each mold with a layer of the strawberry cream cheese kataifi mixture. Add a thin layer of strawberry jam on top of the cream cheese filling. | Cover the filling and jam completely with more melted chocolate.Refrigerate for 10-15 minutes until hard. | Once set, pop out the bars from the mold. | Enjoy! | Love this recipe? ingredients: 3 lb chuck roast | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 6 garlic cloves, minced | 4 roma tomatoes, chopped | 2 tablespoons canned chipotle pepper | ½ large yellow onion, thinly sliced | 10 dried guajillo chiles, seeds and stems removed | 5 arbol chiles | 6 cups beef broth, plus more for braising, if needed | 5 large bay leaves | 2 tablespoons beef bouillon | 3 tablespoons chili powder | ½ tablespoon smoked paprika | 2 teaspoons dried thyme | 1.5 tablespoons ground cumin | 1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns | 1 tablespoon mexican oregano | 1 cinnamon stick | sourdough bread, sliced | cheddar cheese, sliced | shredded oaxaca cheese | 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, for grilled cheese | ½ yellow onion, diced, for sandwich | cilantro, roughly chopped
directions: Season the chuck roast generously with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the meat sear on all sides, until browned and a crust has formed. Remove beef and set aside. | In the same pot, add garlic, tomatoes, chipotle peppers, and onions and cook until softened and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes. | Add the seared beef back in, along with the guajillo and arbol peppers, beef broth, and al | Next, add in your seared beef, chili peppers, beef broth, bay leaves, chili powder, smoked paprika, thyme, cumin, peppercorns, oregano and cinnamon stick. Stir. | Cover and simmer on low heat for 2 hours, until meat is falling apart. Remove the meat and vegetables, leaving the broth in the pot. Blend vegetables, then stir back into the broth. Shred beef and add back into the broth. | Melt butter on a griddle or skillet over medium heat. Add two slices of bread down. Place two slices of cheddar cheese and two slices of Oaxaca cheese on each slice of bread. | Add shredded beef on the bread, followed by some of the sauce sauce, onions, and cilantro. Allow cheese to melt, and bread to get toasty, then fold up the sandwiches. | Serve with more broth for dipping. | Enjoy! | Ready for a smarter way to find recipes?
